Reviews.Title: “Facelifted!”
Reviews.Author: donz06
Reviews.Content: Just had an enjoyable weekend at this property. This place is an old property, but you wouldn't know it by the appearance. They have renovated the hotel, top-to-bottom. When we arrived, we were greeted by "Rolando" @ the front desk. He was professional, prompt & very courteous. We were gieven a very updated, tastefully designed room with a heavenly king bed, walk-in shower & pleanty of room to relax. Every employee we encountered, even housekeeping, were exceptionally courteous. Addition: Great restaurants in & within walking distance to this property.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Beautiful Hotel. Average Location.”
Reviews.Author: wferriter
Reviews.Content: This hotel is top of the line times ten. Definitely the nicest hotel that I've stayed in in a long, long while. The rooms are HUGE, the furniture is tasteful and interesting, the pool is amazing and the fitness room is the biggest in any hotel that I've ever been to. The only hitch is the location isn't great for tourists. While you're literally staying at the best mall in Dallas -- and while the hotel has several access points that can take you directly into the mall -- if you're hoping to do things outside or within walking distance, there's just not much to do. If I were taking my family to see the city, though, I'd probably STILL stay here. The hotel is so nice that I'd spring for a few cabs to the destinations that we wanted to see around town.

Reviews.Title: “Not even poor - but NO housekeeping”
Reviews.Author: gary a
Reviews.Content: AT a premium room with 4 of my employees also staying at the hotel, and returned to my room to find there had been no visit by housekeeping for the day - - dirty towels, unmade bed, room service cart still in room - -what a mess. This has NEVER happened to me - even at Motel 6. Very disappointing for a Westin hotel to have this level of cavalier attitude toward goes. They offered to send someone up - -but come on - -- it's 11:30 PM and I'm up for an early flight. Clearly a hotel that doesn't "get" business travelers.

Reviews.Title: “Service and Location”
Reviews.Author: ChrisV8
Reviews.Content: We like to stay at Starwood hotels because we are elite members of the SPG Program. We chose this facility while in Dallas because of it's location (almost within) the Galleria. We will be back because the staff provided us with exceptional service despite the fact that they were almost 100% full. The rooms are a little stark and modern for our taste. But since the Heavenly Bed is always so consistently comfortable, we wouldn't let that influence us. We love to feel special and the staff went out of their way to make us feel welcome and comfortable. Their warmth was heartfelt and very much appreciated!

Reviews.Title: “Great location but the hotel misses the mark in many areas”
Reviews.Author: TravelerDavidfromGA
Reviews.Content: As a business traveler I am in a hotel about 40 weeks of the year and build my rating of a hotel on the numerous chains and locations that I frequent. I stayed at the Westin Galleria Hotel in Dallas 20+ days over a four week period to find it to be average. The location is perfect for the mall, and number of restaurants in the area but the hotel does not jump out or provide anything to make the stay special. The rooms are dated with older furnishings in some rooms that show many years of wear. The highway side of the hotel provides a dull roar of traffic 24-7 but the back side overlooking the mall is much better. There are two restaurants in the hotel; one that is part of the hotel and the other is leasing space. Both of the restaurants are overpriced for the food quality and quantity received. For the money, Del Frisco's Steak House is much better quality food in a better atmosphere. Some of my frustration with the hotel is with the staff that did not appear to be knowledgeable about the hotel, how to handle any special requests, and how to extend the check out date on your stay. On my second trip to the hotel, I requested a room away from the highway, as the sleepless week before was not good, only to be given a room facing the highway that had been smoked in without proper cleaning. That same trip I requested information about a promotion that SPG was providing only to find that 3 out of the 4 people at the front desk did not know anything about the promotion and made no attempt to find out any information. On my third trip, I needed to stay over the weekend and an extra week and called down to make the arrangement which were to be taken care of but the end of the first week I received my bill under the door which is typical on you last day only to find the staff had not made the changes and were expecting me to leave per my first reservation. The issues with the staff lie with the managementâ€™s responsibility to properly train the staff before allowing them to interact with customers. The second issue I have with the Westin Galleria is the lack of services provided and the excessive fees for any service that is provided. There was a $12 fee for the delivery of a UPS package to my room (in which I tipped the delivery person $5 not knowing I was being charged $12 for the delivery), and $2 charge for a call to SPG to ask about a promotion at the hotel. If you are in Dallas for shopping at the Galleria, the hotel is in the perfect location and the euphoria of shopping may help overcome the short-comings of the hotel and staff.

Reviews.Title: “Great Dallas Hotel - North of City”
Reviews.Author: carrotop
Reviews.Content: Unique location - attached to large mall. Other reviews are accurate, hotel has everything except fine dinning and a bar (they do have a small bar and small dinning on the second floor). However, the mall has numerous places to eat and some have a small attached bar. The pool area is beautiful if the weather is nice. Would definitely stay here again! Regarding parking, you can pay for valet parking, or park in the open mall spots directly in front of the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Connected to a great mall”
Reviews.Author: Frequentflyer666
Reviews.Content: This hotel was recently renovated and the new decor is quite contemporary. I had a king bedroom. It was very spacious. In fact, I think they could have used a bit more furniture. I like the decor, and the bathroom/shower was very nice. Desk was very spacious. Coffemaker was good too. They have gotten rid of the minibar and instead offer some sort of room service. I didn't use it; I wish there was just a minibar like in most hotels. Being connected to the mall is a great plus. It's a very nice mall, with a lot of dining options. The Oceanaire is a chain, but a nice one. I was here on business, and from that standpoint the hotel is OK, but quite honestly I would be just as happy being in the Hyatt DFW and not having to travel back and forth. But if you are planning to visit Dallas for fun, this is a nice hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great location. Friendly warm service.”
Reviews.Author: SondraTexas
Reviews.Content: Great location. Very quiet. We expected the hotel to be on the noisy side since we were staying at the Galleria. We had a very quiet, restful stay. We were warmly welcomed by the staff and they went out of their way to get us the rooms we wanted. Would love to stay at this hotel again!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Hotel attached to mall”
Reviews.Author: RevenueManager78
Reviews.Content: This is one of my favorite Westin Hotels and attached to a top end mall, perfect. Just 20-30 mn from the airport the location was great. I was in an executive level room with a balcony overlooking the city - flat but great. Newly renovated so the rooms are great and large bathrooms.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome-ness!”
Reviews.Author: LovelyL1946
Reviews.Content: Had to write a glowing review about this hotel....we enjoyed our stay so much! The pool was closed for maintenance and the usual rooms only have walk in shower so I called the morning of to see if I could upgrade and who ever the lady I thank her so much because she gave us a corner suite on 21st floor because it had a garden tub to soak since we could not do pool in hotel. Oh the room was so great we loved it! Also, there was a continental breakfast which was cool, but since they already have scrambled eggs I just feel like they should go ahead and add a meat option and the breakfast would be great....also evening time wine and snacks were great as well. You didn't even have to walk outside to go to mall or restaurants in mall if you wanted to eat or shop which was also awesome since parking at galleria without valet can be bad. Great experience...my new favorite hotel in Dallas when visiting!

Reviews.Title: “Only caters to platnium”
Reviews.Author: Nightro
Reviews.Content: When I called to provide my gold spg number I was told that they don't do any thing for gold members as they have too many platniums. Ok... Anyways. Room was nice, typical westin though would say the heavenly bed was the worst one I have slept in. There for a conference and other than the mall there is really nothing near. I would have rather stayed in the city and drove in for the conference. Being stuck at a mall for days was brutal. Refuse to to stay on the freeway side whatever you do. You will be right on top of it and being near the top floor will do nothing to mute it. Bring a sound machine as it goes all night and is very noticeable. Very bad insulation.

Reviews.Title: “Quite and Big Rooms!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Nicoleb1978
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel and location. The rooms are so quite and that is rare. The rooms are also very big. I will be back....

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel but big WiFi issues...”
Reviews.Author: LeisureErik
Reviews.Content: Stayed on one of the SPG floors in a very nice room... But the WiFi signal was very weak. Intermittent at times which was more frustrating than no signal. Tech support was not helpful and admitted that they have signal issues to the corner rooms, especially when the hotel is full and lots of people are using WiFi. As a business traveler this did not meet my needs and was very frustrating.

Reviews.Title: “Never disappoints”
Reviews.Author: elizabethpg
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this Westin location a few times now and it is still one of the best. Huge rooms with modern linens and furniture make for a comfortable stay. Being attached to the mall is a plus when you are traveling for work and looking for something to do. The staff is friendly and provides prompt attention to special requests and rooms service orders. Like other hotels in Dallas, it is often home to multiple conventions and meetings at one time, so if you are looking for a quiet place to hang out you are best off sticking to your room and should avoid the lobby and other common areas. Overall, I always look forward to being booked at the Westin when in Dallas.

Reviews.Title: “Great Business Stay!”
Reviews.Author: RobertSATX
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Westin Galleria in Dallas for a three day business trip. The check in and check out process was quick. The customer service was excellent and employees were very willing to assist. The price per night was a bit high (about $300) and I probably would not have stayed in this hotel if I had to pay for it on my own. The room was large and well decorated. I really liked the fog free bathroom mirror. The hotel is connected to the Galleria mall and there are also several nice restaurants within a short walk. Here is a tip: If you are feeling thirsty, ask the clerk at the front desk for bottled water. They have bottled water behind the desk for guests and it is better than buying it from the mini-bar. Overall, it was a great business stay.

Reviews.Title: “Expected more for the price.”
Reviews.Author: AMA768
Reviews.Content: A colleague and I checked out of the Westin Galleria Dallas today after a 2-day work conference held at the hotel. For 2 nights, our room was priced at well over $500. When that kind of money is involved, there are certain expectations that naturally occur, the most important being cleanliness. As hotels are a public place, there are certain cautions that one might expect to take in general - like using a Clorox wipe on the remote control or not walking around in the bathroom with bare feet, for instance. What is NOT expected, is to find semen stains dotting and dripping down the headboard, which was the case in our room. Of course, this left me feeling quite uneasy and not really able to relax and "enjoy" my stay. A little more attention by the housekeeping staff would be appreciated, as these stains weren't exactly invisible. Anybody paying any attention at all would have noticed, and thus should have been cleaned accordingly. While I am aware that my room has been occupied many times prior to my arrival, I do not expect to deal with the things previous guests leave behind. Uncool, Westin. (While I do have a picture of the stains, I will refrain from posting them on this public site.)

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel with large rooms”
Reviews.Author: williamtwo
Reviews.Content: I booked through Priceline at $73 a night taxes included, which is an unbeatable rate for this hotel. I would have given it 5 stars but 1) I didnt get a chance to eat in the hotel eateries 2) my bathroom drains were clogged upon first using my shower and sink - the hotel did repair them immediately after I reported - very quickly. I stayed in room 1707 from Feb 5 - 7th, 2012 and the room view was great.Checkin was a breeze at 2pm on a SuperBowl Sunday. OTHER ITEMS: I requested housekeeping for cleaning during lunch hours and my room was always ready upon return - great service on that front. No issue with connecting to wifi other than the cost of $10 per day per device. SPG floors always had stack of USAToday and WSJ available each morning near the elevator. I love the location of this hotel. Its right at the Northeast corner of the Dallas North Tollway and 635 connected to the Dallas Galleria for easy access to shopping. Its right next to the Corner Bakery, Grand Luxe Cafe (Upscale CheeseFactory owned by the same) and Starbucks in the mall for a quick bite or coffee. Self-parking is free and if full park at Nordstroms right next door. Valet is $25 per night. Rooms are large, have HD LCDs and large bathrooms - I believe I was in an executive suite. NOTE: my shower was very large and had a dual showerhead which was awesome, however it did not have a bathtub so not sure if the hotel has rooms with tubs or not. If I was traveling with my family, I would call directly before booking and/or at checkin. Also, note there are 5 elevators and I didnt have to wait longer than 60 seconds for an elevator returning or leaving my room floor and there were 2 conference booked at the hotel. Anyway, I would love to stay here again. Dont forget about the Westin heavenly beds that greatness.....

Reviews.Title: “Very nice stay”
Reviews.Author: Jaylasmom
Reviews.Content: We stayed the weekend at this hotel. The rooms were clean and comfortable. We were on the 11th floor facing the highway. You could hear the cars going by but it didn't bother me. They have curtains that will black out the room for good rest. It has a shower with 2 shower heads and two people can easily fit. The people were friendly and helpful. The valet guy even pointed out a parking place for us so we didn't have to pay extra for the valet parking. I will say the bathroom sink upper edge does need a deep clean. This is what I noticed when I sat down on the toilet since it was at eye level. Other than that everything was great. It's also awesome being right there and being able to walk out of your room into the mall.

Reviews.Title: “Super stay”
Reviews.Author: AmarilloByMorning
Reviews.Content: We spend a lot of time in Dallas, and until now, we have not chosen a "go-to" hotel, simply because there are so many fine places to stay. The Westin Galleria is our new favorite. Because we had caught an early morning flight, we arrived at the hotel at 9:30 am, expecting to leave our bags with the bellman. To our surprise, we were shown to our beautiful, contemporary room on the 8th floor, but it was right by the elevators. I expected to hear "dings" and rowdy weekend guests all night, but we slept the sleep of the dead in the luxurious, perfect bed. The room was uniquely designed by placing the built-in dresser/fridge/safe/coffee maker unit against the outside wall, along with giant windows which boasted sunshades and blackout curtains. There was even a cushioned window seat with pillows. The glassed shower drained well, which is not always the case, and the hotel is attached to the Dallas Galleria. Free parking, and walking to Nordstrom, etc. What's not to love?

Reviews.Title: “Really Nice place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: afclakr
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Westin at Galleria Mall for 4 nights and it was a very restful and enjoyable stay. Front desk staff polite, friendly, professional, and helpful. Valet staff was speedy bringing your car up, polite and helpful with directions if needed. The housekeeping staff was dry through in servicing my room. It's location next to the Galleria Mall was a bonus! Would I stay again? absolutely!!! Thanks Westin Galleria Staff!

Reviews.Title: “Good Business/Shopping Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Allen T
Reviews.Content: Went for work... Very close to everything in Dallas... Right next to a mall... Seafood resturant downstairs was above average... Plenty of options and places to eat... Rooms were nice and clean... staff very friendly... very enjoyable stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great family weekend!”
Reviews.Author: australiawithkids
Reviews.Content: No, we don't have little girls who would go crazy at the American Girl store next door... but we do have two young boys ages 10 and 14 who absolutely love this hotel. Why? Because how easy is it stay at the hotel -- and walk out of the elevator, turn right and you're in the mall? Yes, the mall is the attraction here, but a good one. Anchor stores of Nordstrom's, Macy's and Saks Fifth Ave, but my boys want to go to the Sony Store and ice skating and then top it off with a fruit smoothie. A great food court on the 3rd floor as well. We have stayed on the concierge floor each time we have stayed here, by asking nicely at the desk, we have gotten bumped up. The concierge rooms are spacious, clean and have fabulous city views from the 19th and 20th floors. A solid excellent. You can actually opt to save $5 on your bill if you choose not to have your sheets changed, I thought that was an interesting Westin green approach. The concierge dining room on the 21st floor is also fabulous, with food, drink and did I say view? The food for breakfast was cooked oatmeal with all of the toppings, and scrambled eggs, croissants, danish, bagels and a stunning array of fresh fruits. The "dinner" is at 5-7 pm with hot entrees each day as well. Parking is a bit challenging. On the weekdays no problem parking out front with easy access, but on the weekend, we parked in Nordstroms and walked to the hotel entrance saving the valet $15 fee each day. We have stayed at this hotel three times and each time, it delivers!

Reviews.Title: “One little problem...the rest very good.”
Reviews.Author: Eltenista
Reviews.Content: My First visit to hotel. Enjoyed the days because is into the mall and I was buying every days of my travel. However, I found a little problem: Is a difference that I didnt see in other hotels with same level, the clean workers didnt order the things clean personal in the bathroom. So when I came back to room always pe the Brushteeth, soap, contact lenss were desorderes. The rest of services were very good. One night,suddenly my TV had not sound. After 10 minutos, two technician was coming to repair it and resolved the problem.

Reviews.Title: “Fun Mother/Daughter trip”
Reviews.Author: hlmom
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at the Westin several times in the past two years. I have two daughters who love American Girl dolls, so we travel there at least twice a year. The Westin is perfectly located and very convenient with children. There is a Starbucks right outside the second floor entrance which was lovely to have at 7 when only those of us with children would be awake on vacation. Also, the rooms are extremely clean and large for a hotel room. We have done the American Girl package which is a nice touch and the girls always enjoy it. Really I have no negative things to say about it, which is really amazing. (Just ask my husband)

Reviews.Title: “Nice room, great location”
Reviews.Author: Susana114
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed here for a business trip and really liked the hotel. It's in a great location attached to the Mall, so it was super convenient to get morning coffee, stop at a restaurant and do some quick shopping between meetings. I used the valet at checkin, as I arrived late in the evening and had bags to carry. Glad I did that. The free parking lot nearby gets full in the evening, but seems open during the day. The room was very modern and comfortable, typical of a Westin property. I love Oceanaire and enjoyed eating there one night. I met colleagues for a late dinner/drinks at the Second Floor bistro and enjoyed that too, although we were greeted rudely at arrival and asked not to be loud. Really? The bar was packed, but there were exactly two people in the bistro itself, so they could have used some "loud," aka guests. Other than that, I wouldn't hesitate to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Worst Experience from Westin Ever!”
Reviews.Author: MiaNikki
Reviews.Content: Came in late evening around 10pm, brought kids, reserved a corner suite with a connecting room, checked in at front desk got room keys go upstairs only to discover the rooms are very far apart! Go back to front desk to get it rectified and they send us back upstairs with new rooms only to discover they are 2 double rooms ( one is handicap)! Go back to front desk AGAIN....get 2 NEW rooms that were connecting but not a suite and one was STILL handicap!!! We settle after trying to check in for an hour and a half!! Then found hair on toilet, hair on the bed, and hair in our room service food!!! I called front desk before ordering room service to insist they pay for our dinner, and the mgr. Maria said and I quote, "How many people we talkin about". I said the same four you sent back and forth 3 times! Unwilling to pay for the whole dinner, she did give a $50 credit, but with hair in the food I don't know how big a favor that really was!! Anyway, service extremely poor, we are preferred guests who travel internationally and we have NEVER had this kind of service before by Westin!! #absolutelyridiculous

Reviews.Title: “Can't beat the location!”
Reviews.Author: susieq71
Reviews.Content: The hotel lobby opens into the mall, making it an ideal hotel for those who love to shop, and anyone else during the holiday season. Restaurant in the main lobby closes early (10pm) but upstairs bar is open late and has a decent menu.

Reviews.Title: “Solid Choice with Superb Location (Especially for Shoppers)”
Reviews.Author: MonkeyGreen
Reviews.Content: Another solid Westin property, as expected. It is amazing how consistent this brand is. The best part about the property is the location. Close to everything in Far North Dallas and beyond as it sits off the Toll Road. It also happens to be attached to one of the best malls in America which is only a drawback if you rise early and have to wait for the stores to open! Friendly staff, lots of meeting space,reasonable pricing and all those nice SPG Perks we like. A solid choice

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel for Shoppers”
Reviews.Author: Atomique
Reviews.Content: Westin Galleria in Dallas is a great hotel for people who enjoy shopping and malls. I made last minute reservations via a third party travel agency to come to Dallas for a few days for an interview. Not knowing the area the Westin was easy to find via GPS from the main airport. Parking was limited every time I came and left the hotel. If you don't use valet expect to walk at least a few blocks distance. The hotel is literally in a mall. I personally can't stand indoor shopping malls, just not my thing. The staff was friendly and services are what I would expect of a Westin caliber hotel. Rooms are only accessible by your hotel key so the upper floors don't have mall patrons wondering around. The hotel was clean and secure. Business center was limited, small and dark. They do offer printing and copying service for a fee. The room was spacious. Nice big comfy clean bed. I liked the seat by the window with a view, had take out dinner one night watching the traffic and lights of Dallas talking with friends. Big cabinet in the room houses coffee maker, safe, and minibar. There was a light in the cabinet that wouldn't shut off. Good quality coffee. Very nice photographs decorating the room. Decent sized flat screen TV. No free wifi. Bathroom was good sized and clean. Granite counters and nice toiletries. I like magnified lighted make up/shaving mirrors. No tub but awesome shower. Overall it was a nice room. But for my taste, not my setting. Way too far to walk to parking and expensive wifi.

Reviews.Title: “This is a fantastic hotel with a great view from the unique window seat in the room.”
Reviews.Author: ND4health
Reviews.Content: I especially love the huge panoramic window in the room with a cushioned window seat allowing me to gaze on Dallas' splendor. The rooms are spacious and the bed super. My favorite part was relaxing in the window seat looking out over Dallas at night with all the city lights. It was also convenient to be able to walk directly to the mall for a diversion (without having to go outside or atch a cab). Direct service from the airport by super shuttle makes it very convenient as well as 2 superb restaurants that offer gluten free options.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Westin Property”
Reviews.Author: Honeymooner12345
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the Westin Galleria for a weekend. Here are the general comments: Lobby: Beautiful and looks like it just got remodeled-very inviting to sit at one of those big comfortable couches Rooms: Even though we are Starwood Preferred Guests-we were not upgraded..oh well...I like the fact that you need a key to access rooms, especially with so many people around at the Galleria. The halls leading up to the rooms looked very seventies and not remodeled and the rooms were very typical of Westin Properties, Heavenly Bed, older bathroom with old shower head. Service: I don't know if its a Galleria issue (I had this same issue at Houston Galleria Westin) but I just can't figure out why the cleaning staff comes at 3pm to make up your room. We left at 8:30 am for breakfast and then shopping, came back for a nap after lunch, and its not nice to see your room has not been done at 3pm, especially after leaving at 8:30-that in my mind is unacceptable.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place To Get Away!”
Reviews.Author: ozarkviewcondos
Reviews.Content: Normally we would choose our condo in Branson or some other rustic getaway location but business brought us to Dallas for a few days. We decided to stay here so the wife could enjoy some shopping while I was away. Needless to say, she loved it. The surprise was that I did too. If you stay here there is no need to drive anywhere to eat or have a drink. Great place to get away!

Reviews.Title: “A Surprise 5 Star”
Reviews.Author: Andaltex
Reviews.Content: We lived in Dallas many years, visited the Galleria mall many times - as we still do - and the "hotel there" really was of no consequence to us. On a recent trip back, we had the opportunity to stay a night at the Westin. Wow - what a surprise!! Adjacent to the North Dallas Tollway, it's really just 15 minutes or less from downtown, DFW airport, or other major places of interest. The staff really couldn't have been better. We had a nice sized and extremely clean room overlooking the pool. The hotel is very quiet and looks to have been recently updated. Additionally, they do not charge a pet fee, something that is now equivalent to the inconvenience of an airline baggage fee; since we usually travel with a small dog, this is a real value add! If you are interested in shopping and eating good food, you really don't have to leave the adjacent mall. This was a top notch hotel, and we'll be delighted to return!

Reviews.Title: “Nice location”
Reviews.Author: RogerRolfRoger
Reviews.Content: Friendly staff, clean newly renovated rooms, right on top af a nice shopping center. The only downside is the dark room I had. I did get a corner room but if you work at the desk the whole day then the room is to dark.

Reviews.Title: “Great property, location and service”
Reviews.Author: Miusa
Reviews.Content: The hotel is part of a the Galleria Mall and has an ideal location. Service was outstanding from the polite friendly service when I checked in right through the helpful and efficient check-out. Both the rooms and the main grounds of the hotel are modern and well maintained. The rooms are well appointed and the bed very comfortable. One feature that is outstanding compared to a number of places I've stayed recently is the availability and location of outlets as well as easy access to inputs for the television/monitor. They have built the inputs and sufficient electrical outlets into the desk/workspace. My only complaint, and it is a very minor one, is parking. There are a few surface level spaces available outside the front of the hotel which are convenient and free. The hotel also offers valet parking for $15/day. The alternative for self-parking when the few spaces in the front of the hotel are occupied (which was often the case in the evening) is to use the underground mall parking. These spaces do not have direct access to the hotel which seems odd and requires that you exit through a dimly lit stairwell which exits at the side of the hotel. Then you need to walk through an area the staff of the hotel and mall use as a smoking area. The walk while not especially long isn't the most scenic and would be more of an inconvenience during inclement weather. A direct entrance from the garage to the hotel lobby would be a nice addition. This is an outstanding hotel with service to match.

Reviews.Title: “OK hotel, but good for shoppers”
Reviews.Author: Cruise,J.D.
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed here for three nights on a short vacation to Dallas. Overall, it was a pleasant stay, but there were a few problems. The hotel is nice and clean with a modern look. It is conveniently located next to major thoroughfares and if you like to shop, it would be hard to beat the location. Our room had a nice window seat and the bed was very comfortable. It was probably the most comfortable hotel bed I have ever slept in. The view was great from our room on the 13th floor. The shower was also nice and roomy with plenty of hot water and good water pressure. The hotel staff was friendly and helpful. We did experience a few problems though. The thermostat in the room did not work properly and there was quite a bit of noise from the road. We requested a fan, which was quickly provided, and it helped drown out the road noise. The bathroom did not contain a vent, so it became very muggy and hot when taking a shower. The room was a little smaller than I had expected. The parking situation also leaves something to be desired unless you want to spring for the expensive valet parking. We used the parking garage at the mall because the spaces near the hotel entrance were almost always taken. Overall, I think there may be better options unless you plan to do a lot of shopping at the mall. It is not a bad hotel, but I would not recommend it at the retail room rate. If you can get a deal on Priceline or some other discount for this hotel, I think it is acceptable.

Reviews.Title: “Leisure and shopping weekend, overall a great hotel and good stay”
Reviews.Author: TX0810
Reviews.Content: Stayed here on a Friday and Saturday night, for a weekend of shopping (wife). Overall it was great stay and somewhat relaxing when we where not on the go. Stayed here coz it was connected to the Galleria unlike some hotels that claim to be and saved me the drive, also we like the westin hotels and its heavenly bed. Hotel has been renovated since last time we stayed here and it improved its room and looks a lot. Checkin was great, fast and friendly. We asked for a fridge in the room and it was delivered in less than 10 minutes, same for the bathrobes on a later time. To get to the Galleria, all we needed to do was go the 2nd floor and you come out right by corner bakery which we stopped by twice for breakfast ( which is good ). Westin was valet parking costing $14 and $24 for overnight parking. Its hard to find parking right in front of the hotel but i got lucky on both days, but had to park in the purple garage in some occasions when coming back from our other trips outside the mall. If you are not on a budget and planning to visit the galleria anyway, this would be a good hotel for you. Or just in town and need a central location this is a good hotel too, its right beside the dallas tollway and 635. If i have to complain about 1 thing, its the AC. At least in our room, it was located in a corner and did not directly hit the bed which is the way i like it. It kept the room cool, but i wonder what it would be like when it was 100 degrees outside like 2 months ago. Looks like AC was not part of the renovation it got. Anyway, like is said before this was a great stay and looking forward on our next stay here or at another starwood property.

Reviews.Title: “Shopper's Dream!”
Reviews.Author: Jaguilar24
Reviews.Content: Attended a conference held at the Westin Galleria and enjoyed the hotel and the internal access straight into the Dallas Galleria mall. Easy access to tons of excellent food and fabulous shopping! The hotel even offers a shoppers get-away that gives you one night at the hotel for $500 but also includes a $500 gift card for the Galleria mall - essentially you stay for free and just go shop! The hotel itself had very nice and comfortable guest rooms although it didn't have as many amenities as other Westin hotels at which I have stayed. Having the Galleria right there more than makes up for it though - would stay again, next time for "fun"!

Reviews.Title: “Great stay!”
Reviews.Author: GettingThereisHalf
Reviews.Content: Traveled there on business and had a great stay. The rooms were very spacious with a large window and sitting bench under the window. WiFi was a little funny as you had to "re-login" every time you shut down your computer, but it was nice to be able to use multiple devices under the same access code, i.e. my ipad and laptop - but definitely write down your access code as you will need to re-enter it each time you open a browser. . . This hotel is ideal for those looking to go shopping, you simply walk out of the lobby and you are in the mall with plenty of great shops and places to eat. I ate at MiCocina where the food was great, but service was a tad slow. We grabbed some late night drinks in the bar which was company, then had breakfast in there the same day. Great trip, very nice hotel and perfect location.

Reviews.Title: “No Complaints but Nothing Special”
Reviews.Author: Brad G
Reviews.Content: Easy check-in, nice staff, ok rooms, much to do with Galleria Mall, places to eat and night life....close too Beltline Road with all it's night life. But at $175 for a King room (last minute decision to stay here)....it was nothing special. Stayed in better and worse.

Reviews.Title: “Solid Stay at Westin Galleria Dallas”
Reviews.Author: jcmmhuff
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a 3 night stay with my daughter at the Westin Galleria Dallas. All in all, we were very happy with the accommodations. I had gotten a fantastic rate on the hotel through Hotwire, and was very pleased to learn it was the Westin Galleria. The location of this hotel was absolutely perfect for a girls' weekend of shopping. We loved being attached to the Galleria, and it was so close to everywhere we wanted to go. We opted for the free self parking in the purple garage, as it was very conveniently located near the hotel entrance. Check in was prompt. We were given a king room on the fifth floor. The room was very spacious, clean, and well appointed. Loved the heavenly shower and bed. Having Starbucks coffee in the room was also a nice touch. The only minor drawback was that the view from our window looked down to the interior ballrooms below, as opposed to the outside. My 11 year old was mildly disappointed, but it had no real impact on the stay until Saturday night, when a "Sweet 16" party was held in the area. We were able to hear the thumps of the music for quite a while, and early the next morning, we were awakened by what I assume was cleanup efforts going on below. In the grand scheme of things, it was a small price to pay for an otherwise lovely stay.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely wonderful”
Reviews.Author: theseoldroads
Reviews.Content: I travel a lot, and the Westin Galleria is easily among the top of my hotel experiences. I stayed for four days for a conference and everything was amazing. From the get-go the front desk service was excellent and the valets were very helpful as well. I stayed in a large corner suite where the floor to ceiling windows gave me a wonderful view. The bathroom was luxurious and the bed was easily the most comfortable one I've ever slept in. The room was something I looked forward to spending a little down time in. WiFi was a little tricky from mobile devices (you had to keep entering a password), but from there was a wired option available for laptops. The food was terrific, both what was served at the conference and in the 2nd floor restaurant. There were many healthy options, which is sometimes hard to find. The service in that restaurant was excellent and the prices were quite reasonable. Moreover, from the second floor you had direct access to the shopping centre which was incredibly convenient! I also rented a car from the Hertz that is on the second floor lobby. The service was friendly and rates were good. It was quite convenient as we were able valet park the car for $25 overnight and then return the car at the airport. There was also a fabulous open air swimming pool and the most awesome geared-out fitness centre (it actually made me disappointed I didn't bring my running shoes!). My only complaint was that the sound on my tv kept cutting in and out, or out entirely (something not experienced by other guests). I didn't bother calling anyone about it since it wasn't that important to me, but I did write about it in the comment card. The next day I received an email from the Director of Operations thanking me for bringing this to their attention so they could fix it. I know had I contacted someone during my stay, I would have received excellent service! Overall, my stay was incredible. I'd definitely return. The Westin Galleria has obviously built up their reputation on outstanding customer service and high quality amenities.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Westin!”
Reviews.Author: dcfergs
Reviews.Content: Ok I will start out by saying I am SPG Platinum and have had the opportunity to stay at many Westin hotels. This Westin is one of my favorites and I will tell you why. 1. Free parking in the gallaria parking lot 2. Super convienient (ocianaire grill, starbucks, subway, corner bakery and a ton of other things within 2 minute walk) 3. Friendly staff (offered water and green rewards at check in) 4. Super nice club lounge. Free wine and beer and great apps in a club lounge (unlike aweful Houston Westin Gallaria)!! Did I mention breakfast as well? Ana in the lounge is awesome and the service in the lounge at night and the morning is unmatched. Way to go Westin Gallaria management, I will be back everytime I am in Dallas.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: lavonnemy
Reviews.Content: Recently stayed here attending a genetics conference. We had a lovely oversized room, clean and comfortable. There was wi-fi in the rooms. Conference food can be very dull, but not here. Breakfast and lunch were included in our registration and it was amazing. The buffets included many choices and the serving staff were very friendly. With its location right in the Galleria mall, there was no need to leave. Highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A Very Good Choice”
Reviews.Author: PAQ
Reviews.Content: As a Platinum level SPG member, I stay at dozens of Starwood hotels, including Westin hotels, every year. I especially liked this hotel because of its huge club lounge with comfortable seating and a variety of cold and hot food for breakfast. The oversized room with traditional Westin shower were nice, as were the HDTV and traditional Westin Heavenly Bed. I did not like the employee in the club lounge handing out cards asking for a tip. First time I have seen this in a Starwood Club Lounge, and recommend the mananger to discontinue this practice. Attached to a huge indoor mall, and only a 15 minute ride from the airport (no traffick) was convenient.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Stay - Great Location”
Reviews.Author: tomandcynthia
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel for a recent mother/daughter trip to Dallas. This hotel is connected to a mall (Galleria Dallas), a mall that ranks as a true shop-till-you-drop experience. However, we were too busy exploring the city to shop (maybe next time). This hotel's great location makes it a short drive to anywhere in the DFW area. The hotel was well appointed with a relaxed, welcoming ambience. Great staff. Our room was spacious, clean and beautifully appointed. We loved the wonderful window seat which was padded and pillowed so you could stretch out and read. The bathroom was also top notch with a large walk-in shower and double shower heads. The beds and bedding were top notch. You had the choice of using the valet ($24 for overnight parking) or self-parking at no charge. Our room window overlooked the hotel pool which seemed large and well appointed with private cabanas. We did not use the workout area. There were plenty of eateries/restaurants in and around the hotel/mall. We previously stayed at the Sheraton in Dallas and rate this hotel much higher in quality and cost. My daughter enjoyed the trip so much she wants to make it an annual event (I wholeheartedly agree and will definitely be staying at The Westin Galleria). The only reason I did not rate this hotel as five stars was the lack of a fridge to store your inevitable leftovers from restaurants. There is a beverage/candy/misc. fridge which is content sensitive (i.e. when you take out a bottled water, it senses what you removed and charges your room automatically -- watch your bill as we were incorrectly charged for something we did not remove -- also the contents are expensive). Also be aware there is road construction everywhere so allow for extra time.

Reviews.Title: “Topnotch service, handsome decor, great shopping/eating”
Reviews.Author: MidwestBoomer
Reviews.Content: When I checked in, I had forgotten to bring my Texas tax exemption certificate. That was important. I was attending a meeting of an organization that is exempt from Texas lodging tax. However, it was no problem. I mentioned it to the clerk at the check-in desk. Without hesitation, she produced the form and showed me how to complete it. When I left, I again experienced topnotch service. The meeting ended, and several of us converged on the bellman to retrieve our stored luggage so we could head for the airport. Multiple staff members appeared, and they quickly retrieved the bags. The wait was brief. During my stay, I was impressed with the decor that seemed reminiscent of the early 1960s: minimal, spare, but handsome--in a way that made me recall pictures of Japanese dwellings. I'm glad I arrived a little early. The hotel is adjacent to the Dallas Galleria. Walk out of the hotel lobby, and you're in the Galleria's collection of shops, mainly clothing shops and restaurants. Among the unusual shops: one devoted to watches and another to flip flops. The restaurants range from fast food to modest French, Mexican, and Italian eateries at the Galleria's ice skating rink. Across the street from the Galleria is The Container Store. The meeting itself went smoothly--no problems at all with sound, audiovisual equipment, or temperature. I was impressed with the popularity of the fitness center; at 6 am nearly all the aerobic equipment was in use. A word of caution: the drive from DFW airport to the hotel was roughly 25 minutes on I-635, with no traffic problems; however, on other trips I've experienced congestion on I-635 . . . so allow plenty of time for the trip.

Reviews.Title: “Above and Beyond”
Reviews.Author: Crow1984
Reviews.Content: There aren't enough words to descibe my wife and I's stay here at the Westin Galleria Dallas. We've been coming to this hotel for 5 years now and our recent stay was by far the best. This trip was for a celebration of my wife's birthday. From the time we pulled in for check-in to the time we had to say good bye, every single employee at the hotel, valet, front desk, concierge, housekeeping, went "above and beyond" their jobs to make sure our stay was the best one yet! I recommend this hotel to anyone considering visiting the DFW area. Guys, this is a great place to take your girl! It's connected to the Galleria Mall, therefore you can take her shopping and when the guys get bored, you can simply go back up to your room or go to the "Second Floor Bistro Bar" for a cold beverage!

Reviews.Title: “Great location wonderful room”
Reviews.Author: LeftyaloneNewOrleans
Reviews.Content: The Westin was all we had hoped for. Wonderful staff that assisted in whatever we asked. Our room was large and well furnished. New heavenly beds and flat panel TV were great!

Reviews.Title: “Not bad for a hotel in a mall.”
Reviews.Author: Randy G
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for a couple days this May. It is a very nice hotel and the room prices reflect that. They have a pretty cool layout where the entrances to the hotel are integrated with the Galleria mall (although, I do find it weird to have a Westin in the middle of a shopping mall, period, but Texans apparently don't find that strange at all). The rooms are nice and comfortable, if not overly spacious, and the furniture is pretty new and in good condition. The Heavenly bed used by the Westin chain, of course, lives up to its name. I ate in the "casual" hotel restaurant one day and thought the food was pretty good and in the "fancy" hotel restaurant (Oceanaire), the food is simply awesome. Of course, you have plenty of food options in the Galleria mall itself. For business travelers in that part of Dallas, something to consider between this hotel and Le Meridien across the street is that the Westin has a taxi stand and Le Meridien does not. So if you don't want to rent a car and you want to quickly get a taxi ride whenever you want, the Westin is a much better bet. One minus: I am a Starwood Platinum member but they did not upgrade me to a suite. I did get access to the club/lounge, however, and they had a very nice breakfast spread and delicious appetizers during dinner time. Anyway, I would stay here again if I didn't have to pay for it, but if I'm on my own dime, I would pick Le Meridien across the street. But that's largely because I don't view the Galleria shopping mall as a "vacation destination" where you might want to enjoy a fancy hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A shopper's delight.”
Reviews.Author: Travlingman33
Reviews.Content: I arrived at the Westin Galleria Dallas on a rather scorching day, but came to find out that was completely normal for Dallas. I was greeted by friendly staff who expedited me through the check-in process. The hotel lobby was very modernly decorated and clean. My room was large, smartly decorated (very modern) and clean. The bathroom was large and clean as well. One complain however. While taking a shower, it kept getting cold despite my efforts to the contrary. I discovered that the shower handle had a slight design defect. In order to have the perfect water temperature, one would have to place the rather heavy handle in the horizontal position. Well, the handle had not been tightened down when it was installed, thus it kept sliding down. As it would slide down, it would change the water temperature from perfect to polar ice cold. I pulled a MacGyver and fashioned a knot with a towel around the handle to keep it in place. I immediately called the front desk and notified them regarding the issue. Well, it was never resolved. I would have given this hotel a 5 star rating, if it weren't for that. For those who are shopaholics, you'll be in heaven. The hotel is attached to the Galleria Dallas which makes it very convenient for those diehard mallies. Most stores and restaurants are upscale, but you'll enjoy the scenery regardless of your financial status. I patronized the hotel restaurant once, but was pleasantly surprised by the quality of the food. I'd definitely stay at the Westin Galleria Dallas again and again.....

Reviews.Title: “Sleek and very Satisfying”
Reviews.Author: NGerding
Reviews.Content: Wow! As a 4 star owner of Westin Properties, we elected to land at the Westin Galleria Dallas as a halfway point on our Oklahoma to Arkansas trip to visit our Dad's graveside in Arkansas. The experience was more than we could have ever anticipated. From the moment we drove up, Jeremy greeted us like we were family he had been looking forward to seeing. The front desk family placed us on the Executive 20th Club floor and welcomed us with open arms. When we entered our room and discovered there was no tub, a must for the wife, the front desk quickly moved us to another room (preferred member floor, but a corner suite) It was perfect! Sleek and beautiful with HD televisions, room for relaxing in the living area and the Heavenly Bath, well, just that . . . Heavenly! If that were not enough, the Executive Club lounge an ideal space in which to decompress serving evening beverages including wine and beer and hors d'oeuvres. A short walk over to the Galleria to graze followed as it was so convenient. The following morning prior to leaving for the Arkansas turnaround trip, we once again stopped in at the Executive Club lounge for a continental breakfast which includes beautiful display of freshly cut fruits, bagels, yogurt, scrambled eggs and oatmeal with all the fixin's. Starbucks coffee and fresh juice were drawn for you by the concierge, Ljiljana, a STAR in our day, and placed on your table. She went above and beyond in making sure you were comfortable and never wanting for anything. Westin quality speaks for itself, however sometimes it takes our voices to remind people of the quality of service they offer, their unmatched quality of amenities for both business and amenities and their "breathe" air quality systems. Please note at this property, not only was it sleek and rejuvenating, it was exceptionally quiet! Never did I head another guest walking down the hall, or shutting their door, this was a true delight to the end of every day. We will definitely be back,hopefully sooner than later! This property will not disappoint!

Reviews.Title: “A little disapointed....”
Reviews.Author: Flyinman
Reviews.Content: I reserved an executive club room (August 12th-14th) for our American Girl weekend in Dallas. The American Girl package is an additional cost and my 5 year old was very excited for the this weekend. Check in was very fast and the staff friendly. The room was nice but not quite what I was expecting after seeing newly renovated on the web site. Upon check in I was informed the American Girl package would be delivered between 5pm and 7 pm. We purposely stayed out of the room so upon our return our 5 year old would be excited the see what had been delivered. We returned to the room at 7:30 pm and nothing had been delivered to the room. Needless to say I was upset and my daughter very sad. I called to Express Serice and was told the people making deliveries were backed up and it would be there in 20 minutes. While I was not happy that nothing was in the room, I was willing to allow more time even though being in the room when it is delivered is not quite as exciting. 30 mintues later, nothing, so I called again. This time I was told it would be 2 mintues. Yes, 2 minutes. Well, 4 minutes later nothing, so I went downstairs. At his point I was very angry and made it well known on the phone. When I went downstairs I began explaining what was going on to a person at the front desk. Before I got 10 words out, the person told me to relax in a smart [---] way. This did not make things any better. Finally, the on duty manager spoke with me and informed me everything was on the way and we would have a discounted rate for the 2 nights. While, I appreciate the fact the manager was willing to make this concession, it did not make up for the fact I had a very disappointed 5 year old in the room. The hotel failed to deliver the package on time as well as make it an experience for the child. When I returned to the room, all was there and we were ready to settle. Went to get the coffee ready for the morning and a packet had been used by the previous guest with the open package in the cabinet and the packet of coffee still in the maker. Called to get more coffee around 8:45 pm and nothing was ever delivered. My wife went the club upstairs to fix coffee and was talking to a staff member about the coffee maker. The staff member called the front desk and within minutes someone had called the room. Front desk apologized and sent fresh coffee to the room. However, when delivered we were going to be charged $6.95!! All we wanted was a packet. Luckily the room service attendant put it on the house. The room was nice but nothing to get excited about. The bathroom was like a sauna and would get very hot with the lights on. No ventilation in the bathroom at all. In addition, the hotel wants you to reuse the towels, but hardly anywhere to hang towels. Luckily I travel with a fan and this made the use of the bathroom tolerable. Overall the hotel was very nice. If we were not trying to make this a special weekend with our daughter and did not have the problems with the package all else was satisfactory.

Reviews.Title: “Would stay again if I need to be in the Galleria area again”
Reviews.Author: andymitcho
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 3 nights in a standard room, if you need to be in the North Dallas area this hotel is in an excellent location! The Hotel is attached to the Galleria Shopping Center which can be accessed from the lobby or 2nd floor. Front Desk staff were always friendly and helpful when we needed anything. While not directly related to the hotel the people in this part of Dallas are super friendly making the stay more enjoyable. Only downside really were the guys outside the hotel, they were always busy doing their own thing, twice we had to wait quite some time for them to get us a cab to downtown and always seemed hungry for tips even after giving bad service! Pros - The Galleria shopping center is excellent, its not one of these busy suburban malls full of screaming kids! It does have an ice rink but its not overly busy and noisy, Nice shops including Saks Fifth Avenue, Macys, Nordstrom, Zara and lots of other top end designers. - The basic rooms are quite large and spacious - Quiet rooms, there is a Freeway outside but you cant hear a thing inside the rooms - Fitness center was great, used it everyday, the equipment was modern and well maintained - Pool is always pretty quiet, very clean and nice chairs/shades around the pool and staff on duty very friendly Cons - Not central to downtown Dallas, however there is a bus stop outside to go downtown. - No real nice restaurants close to the Hotel, however plenty of fast food like McDonalds, Taco Bell in the shopping center All in all a great stay, would recommend to others who need to be in the north Dallas area

Reviews.Title: “We go there every Christmas!”
Reviews.Author: SOUTH-TWEEN-ROSE
Reviews.Content: There is great shopping, eating, and ICESKATING!! There is lots of Christmas celebrations and you can ice skate everyday! We always eat at La Madeline because it is on the ice skating floor!

Reviews.Title: “Great staff (esp housekeeping) & nice rooms/facilities”
Reviews.Author: JessicaK16
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Westin Galleria Dallas for two weeks in July and the staff in the hotel did their best to make it feel like home. The front desk was very attentive and provided water on some extremely hot days and the rooms were always well kept. The housekeeping staff, particularly Suada, Benny & Elizabeth, really went out of their way to make sure that my stay was exceptional. The beds are some of the most comfortable I have slept in and there was not a lot of outside noise. I would stay here on future visits to Dallas and recommend this hotel to anyone going to the Dallas area.

Reviews.Title: “This is the best hotel I have stayed at in Dallas”
Reviews.Author: therogerAustin_Tx
Reviews.Content: I wanted to find something negative to say to offset the positives but the worst I can tell you is that I had to walk across a not-large parking lot to my car. Oh, and my pillow was a little flat. lol, that's it. The room was large and nice. My wife hates most hotel beds but really liked this one. Even the bellmen seemed more interested in providing a great experience than in earning a tip. We checked in at midday on a sweltering day and they handed us cold water when we checked in. The rooms and the front desk are are not a long walk from the entrance. There is a large outdoor pool in the center of the hotel. My wife does a lot of business with the Intercontinental just up the road and we were attending a wedding there that night. It is a very nice hotel Long story of how we ended up here but, from the perspective of just the rooms, parking, and basic staff (which is all we dealt with), the Westin wins. Five stars. I recommend it highly. Wait, one more negative. The wife is now telling me that she wants to come back when we have time and shop at the mall. NOOOoooooooo..... lol

Reviews.Title: “Nice room layout and conveniently located”
Reviews.Author: berniss
Reviews.Content: As much as I dislike the arrangement of the Hyatt Grand Cypress room, the layout of the Galleria room was lovely. However, my gripe with this hotel, as with many nowadays, is that you cannot get a room with a bathtub and a king size bed. Only queen size beds are available in rooms with a tub. My other complaint was that this was the first room I had in a long time that was not clean. My sink was coated with soot or rust shavings and I had a dirty towel folded and put away. When I brought it to management's attention, they apologized and offered to send someone there right away. However, it never should have happened.

Reviews.Title: “I really liked this property!”
Reviews.Author: FirstLast
Reviews.Content: The room was very large and spacious. The decor was contemporary and comfortable. The hotel has a direct connection to the mall, and thus coffee shops and restaurants. They charge $24 a night for valet parking, but you can park in the mall parking for free. I parked directly under the hotel in the purple garage and just to the right of the entrance in the blue garage. Very easy. Pleasant staff, quick elevators, nice bedding and bathroom amenities. A little bit of grunge in the corners of the shower but other than that a spot on property. I would stay there again in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant stay on a hot weekend”
Reviews.Author: WordGirlDC
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Westin Galleria for two nights for a family event in June 2011. It was a very pleasant, comfortable hotel. Room was large and clean with a very nice window seat, perfect for reading. Bathroom with large, walk-in shower, also very clean. One small criticism, the design of the shower and bathroom doors don't give you many places to hang up clothes or wet towels. Also, I didn't see an available outlet near the bed, making it difficult to charge a phone and use it as an alarm. But these are minor issues. Health club was clean and had towels, water, and headsets as well as yoga mats and exercise balls. common areas were very nice, with modern decor. Pool area is a bit barren, surrounded by tall buildings on all sides, and with little to no landscaping. Staff was pleasant and helpful. The hotel is attached to the mall, which is very convenient if you don't have a car, giving you access to some dining, shopping and entertainment options. The weakest link I experienced might have been the food, both the free afternoon snack in the lobby and a brunch held in one of the meeting rooms. The food was OK at best and not as good as I've had at equivalent hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Nothing like staying in the mall”
Reviews.Author: aandjSydney
Reviews.Content: Two of us stayed for 1 night at the Westin Galleria Dallas in June 2011. We chose this hotel based on its location within the mall. We have previously stayed at the Westin Galleria in Houston. The hotel is nicely renovated and we had a great room on one of the higher floors. What we loved the most was being able to walk straight into the mall. The Galleria is quite good although I prefer NorthPark. The front desk staff were fantastic. I cannot rate them highly enough.

Reviews.Title: “Very comfortable, but messy parking”
Reviews.Author: sixthgentexan
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for one night and found it to be quite comfortable. The desk staff are very friendly and extremely professional. I had requested a room on a higher floor away from the elevator and away from the highway side in advance since I'm a light sleeper. They accommodated all these requests and I slept great! The rooms are huge and have great window seats overlooking the Galleria. The bathroom was very clean and everything worked well. My only complaint about the room is that the air was turned up so high before I arrived that it was HOT in the room (the outside temperature that day was 103) and took forever to cool down. I understand wanting to save energy, but there's a point at which the temperature needs to be reasonably cool so as not to cause guests to sweat upon arrival. Parking is a bit of a disaster. You can choose to do valet for $25/day or self-park in the underground garage or on the surface lot. As it was too hot to park the car in the sun and I didn't want to pay, I parked myself underground, only to find that there is no elevator to the underground level, so I had to carry my luggage up a set of stairs and around a corner to get to the hotel entrance. What a pain, especially in the heat!

Reviews.Title: “Power shopping central”
Reviews.Author: TraveljunkieTexas
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at the Westin Galleria for some back to school shopping. The hotel has been nicely maintained and updated over the years and is a sleek contemporary hotel with a hip but comfortable vibe. Access is easy from just about any North Dallas freeway and absent traffic is only about 15 minutes from the north entrance to DFW airport. Our check-in was simple and quick with no issues or problems and our request for adjoining rooms was accommodated. Our rooms were clean, modern, visually interesting and rather large compared to many in which we have stayed. The rooms were very quiet and although they could have been a bit cooler it wasn't unpleasant. The real benefit to this hotel is that you can enter the Galleria mall from the lobby or 2nd floor level. This allows you to power-shop, easily go back to the bistro/bar for refreshments, drop off your purchases and voila, you are ready for more. There are several restaurants in the mall and many within a short drive from the mall. Sadly I can no longer recommend the Oceanaire Seafood restaurant located within the Westin Hotel lobby, as it now suffers from mediocre service and below par food - at premium prices. If you search a bit you can find some reasonable rates for the Westin, and save the extra cash for the shopping.

Reviews.Title: “Great place for Christmas shopping weekend”
Reviews.Author: Reuben32
Reviews.Content: My wife and I have stayed here a few times, most recently was last December when we went up to do some Christmas shopping. This is our favorite hotel in the DFW area. The front desk, the valets, and the bellhops are all extremely friendly and helpful. Parking is starting to get expensive, especially in the other hotels in the area, so it is a HUGE plus that you can park at the Galleria for free. The rooms are amazing, my wife loves the tile showers with the dual head spray (we used it as a model when redecorating our bathroom. The ambient lighting throughout the hotel is a great touch, and all of the rooms are kept very clean. The location is great, not only is it attached to the Galleria, but you are about a 15-20 minute drive (less with no traffic) from anywhere you want to be in Dallas.

Reviews.Title: “Unheavenly Stay”
Reviews.Author: suebhoney
Reviews.Content: Let me first say that I chose this hotel based on all the lovely reviews. Ultimately, I was disappointed with my stay. Check-in should have been my first clue. Strike one. The hotel was busy, but not excessively so, and I drove up and waited for valet (which I was going to decline) & bell service (which I wanted). Not getting either, I went to check-in, only to be stopped and told to move my car since I was not using valet. My husband circled as I checked in. Strike two. Check-in went slowly, although there were more employees than guests. More than once I was told to go to left for the guest elevator, which was to MY right. I was never offered bell service, nor courtesy water, nor an orientation to the hotel. The clerk gave me a key, literally said "Here." Strike three. The room. Acceptable for one night at a Holiday Inn near an interstate. Gosh awful for a Westin. Lamp shades were stained. The carpet was coming up at the baseboards. The ottoman was damaged. The bathroom lacked ventilation and was hot & stuffy. The bedding set off my allergies. The clock radio went off at midnight. Ten dollars for 2-bar wireless. And the noise from the interstate was non-stop. We intended to stay several days. We didn't. We checked out early & checked in elsewhere. I don't recommend & I won't be back.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful, as usual!”
Reviews.Author: GC967
Reviews.Content: I have stayed here so many times, I guess I just take perfection for granted! I love the Westin and have been staying here for years, shopping, visiting friends, business, all roads lead to the Westin. When my children were younger my husband would take the boys to Arlington to ball games and Six Flags and they would drop me and the girls at the Westin for a long weekend of shopping and "girl fun". The rooms are clean and comfortable, the employees are always helpful and friendly, and there is never any noise keeping you up at night.

Reviews.Title: “First pick for business hotel in this area”
Reviews.Author: kjhMN
Reviews.Content: The best of the Westins. Really well cared for newer property, clean, contemporary design and good sized rooms, comfy beds, awesome showers, nice staff. Attached to Galleria so if you don't like OceanAire (wait, what?) in the hotel, then you can eat at Grand Lux (upscale Cheesecake Factory) or the sushi bar in the mall, both were good. Hotel has an awesome rooftop/outdoor pool with cabanas for a quiet, late night swim. The downside - not sure I could find one with the hotel overall. There's limited parking in front of hotel, can park free in lower level ramp, and there's no elevator back up so you should leave your luggage with the bellman on the way in or out. Do I want to stay again? Yes, and I will, in fact I already booked it!

Reviews.Title: “Everything you would expect from a Westin Hotel”
Reviews.Author: jmcfarland76
Reviews.Content: I'll start off by saying that I always use a certain website, the one where you do not know the name before you book.... and got an extremely good deal on this room. We were just passing through Dallas and had a short but pleasant stay. Great beds, spotless room, double shower-heads. The hotel is attached to a fancy mall, so if you're in town to shop, this is your spot. The only reason I didn't give this an "Excellent" rating is they want $24 a night for parking....Please. You can park at the mall for free.

Reviews.Title: “Location, location, location and the hotels great too”
Reviews.Author: lujacque
Reviews.Content: We always stay at Westins when we have a choice. The Dallas Westin Galleria never dissappoints. It is a great stay. I booked the room on a third party website and reserved 2 queen beds. Upon arrival the reception said that there were not any of that type room available. I told him that it was what I had booked and he said those were only "preferences" on third party sights. I told him I knew the difference and that this was not what I booked. He asked to see my confirmation. I showed it to him and he made a way to honor my booking. The beds are the most comfortable stay although I do not prefer the sliding glass door on the bathroom. It has no lock therefore when it accidently slides open it can be quite awkward for a son-in -law when sharing a room with your mother-in-law. Unlike the other Westins we have stayed in this year, the a/c seemed to work very good and keep the room cool. The location of the hotel was excellent. Being connected to the galleria is great for having an infant. When my husband or myself need a little extra sleep in the morning, the other one of us had a great place to take the baby on a walk. The restaurants in the area are great. We love the Westin Galleria.

Reviews.Title: “Terrific hotel”
Reviews.Author: dryowza
Reviews.Content: Do you know what makes a terrific hotel? it is the people like the front office managers at this Westin Galleria. I always stay at Marriots because of our platinum status and are almost there with Hyatt and Hilton but this location worked out best for us so we are at a Westin. I came in late last night to a nice room that just wasn't right for us because of some specific needs. Sold out so couldn't change the room but the night front office manager Maria (don't know last name) promised it would be taken care of in the morning. I have heard that before many times since I stay in hotels about 150-200 nights a year. Next morning, the front office manager Michael Truax already knew about our concerns, worked on getting us the room we needed, and really took care of us with a super yes attitude. He is the kind of hotel manager we need more of. Oh yes, the hotel is really nice too, rooms, attached to mall, workout, pool, all superb. we have all been in great hotels and had lousy personal experiences. Not here, these folks know how to treat their guests with people like Maria and Michael. We will be back!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel - Wonderful Location”
Reviews.Author: ASU_RT
Reviews.Content: My partner had never experienced the great shopping that the Dallas area had to offer, so we decided to take a weekend shopping trip to the Big D. I wanted to choose a hotel that was close to a major shopping area so we chose the Westin Galleria. The location was supurb! Very easy access via car being located at the intersection of the LBJ an the North Dallas Tollway. The hotel had very clean rooms and a nice bathroom. Our room, a King Deluxe, was located on the corner with sweeping views of the Metroplex. Being located within the Galleria complex made the trip especially wonderful. I was able to enter the Galleria each morning to dine for breakfast or brunch or to pick up my morning Starbucks. It also came in handy as we could return to the room to drop off our packages. My favorite hotel feature had to be the fragrence. The entire property smelled of white tea. I would highly recommend this property!

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice!”
Reviews.Author: megberries03
Reviews.Content: I enjoyed my stay at the Westin Galleria. I arrived quite late, and received excellent service from the valet and front desk. The first-floor restaurant, Oceanaire, had stopped serving dinner by the time I arrived, but I was able to get a really wonderful meal at the second floor restaurant. I also ordered room service for breakfast, and have no complaints - food and service were both great. My room was very clean and comfortable, and they have a full service business center. My only small complaint was that I couldn't connect to the wi-fi from my iPad, because my room was too far from the elevators, where the signal comes from. Not a big deal - I sat in the very comfortable lobby to use the internet. Overall, this is a phenomenal hotel and I would absolutely return.

Reviews.Title: “Typically good Westin”
Reviews.Author: TravlAgain
Reviews.Content: I often stay at the West Galleria when I'm in Dallas. The hotel is very conveniently-located off I-635. The shopping is exceptional at the Galleria, which is connected to the hotel lobby. For security, the elevators are secured by hotel key cards. The staff is friendly and responsive. I've not had any issues with their staff, and they have generally been helpful. The rooms are typical Westin quality, clean and modern style, although nothing notable. Housekeeping does a good job of maintaining them. Self-parking is free in the subterranean lot for the mall in front of the hotel. I've found this property to be superior to other hotels in the area, which is why I keep returning. Always have a decent stay at the Westin Galleria.

Reviews.Title: “Anniversary Stay”
Reviews.Author: KaptainKAR
Reviews.Content: It was a surprise trip for our 22nd anniversary. The hotel was spotless and the staff was efficient and friendly. We stayed on the 20th floor and had access to the hospitality room where our hostess, Lilianna was friendly and fun. Aramis at the front desk, was also helpfull and check in was a breeze. We did not use valet parking, but there was parking right in front of the hotel and several floors of parking attached to the Galleria. It is a great location for shopping in the Galleria, which is a three story shopping mall with an ice rink. Also, there are restaurants in the Galleria and nearby. Lawrys prime rib was excellent. Have fun.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel - Great Mall”
Reviews.Author: MMBarnes
Reviews.Content: This is a nice hotel with all of what you would expect from the Westin including the price. The lobby is nice as are all parts of the hotel. The rooms were comfortable and updated and spacious. You can look out the window at the highway that you can hear if you really listen but it is not a distraction. There is a large mall you can enter from the lobby of the hotel that has all the places you would like for shopping. There are also a number of good restaurants near the mall. The valet parking is expensive and you can park right near the hotel for free in the mall parking and save quite a bit.

Reviews.Title: “I can't say enough good things”
Reviews.Author: Jsmith60898
Reviews.Content: What a lovely hotel in a great location. The staff was super friendly and helpful. I would definitely stay here every time is $ were no concern. The rooms are incredibly spacious (someone mentioned they've recently been remodeled). And, of course, those Heavenly beds are to die for. A Starbucks in the adjacent mall made it even better.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Modern Hotel- Not so great location!”
Reviews.Author: pez3120
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Westin on New Years Eve while moving cross country. The hotel is easy to get to in the sense that it is right off the highway but it is surrounded with dead end parking garages so read the signs carefully (free parking)! Met by a ton of hotel employees to help, a friendly front desk staff and a cold bottle of water. The lobby was modern, clean and very busy (dont forget that this hotel is attached to a huge mall). Our room was the same as the lobby, also very modern with clean lines and an enormous window and window seat along the far wall. The bed was OK and sheets were some of the nicest I've slept on in a hotel. I did have a few complaints...one, the hotel is right off the highway and the traffic noise did not stop all night! Second, we traveled with our dog and on the plus side Westin had no pet fee (huge!!!) but they also had no place to walk the dog. Something they should consider. Overall...great hotel, great service, but probably best stayed in for a shopping trip!

Reviews.Title: “Luxury (but pricey!) hotel in great location - with fantastic beds!”
Reviews.Author: KSOMMO
Reviews.Content: As a former Dallasite, I've always wanted to stay in the Westen Galleria so I decided to take advantage of a trip to Dallas (to finally see a Cowboys' game in person!) to visit the hotel. I was definitely pleased with the location, service (especially the valet parking - well worth it, especially during the Christmas shopping season), stunning views from the rooms and the absolutely amazing beds! I was a bit disappointed that there was no bathtub (although the shower was nice) and that neither free Internet service nor complimentary breakfast was available. Given the fairly expensive price, it seems like both of these should be offered... But, overall, it was a very nice stay - although probably once-in-a-lifetime at that price.

Reviews.Title: “Nice and comfortable hotel, bad restaurant”
Reviews.Author: anam01
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very nice, comfortable, clean, large rooms, nice bathroom, good location. The only complaint is about its restaurant (2nd floor), even the food is OK, its manager is rude and he makes you wait 30 to 40 minutes to get a table, even if it is not crowded at all.

Reviews.Title: “Modern and Chic Room”
Reviews.Author: coolden
Reviews.Content: Stayed at 20th floor, which is for the Executive club rooms. The room is huge with very nice interior. The decor is also very trendy. I like the seat by the window. The heavenly bed is cozy to ensure my sleep.

Reviews.Title: “Wish there had been a tub”
Reviews.Author: bettyIllinois
Reviews.Content: Staff is very accomodating and helpful. Our room was small but modern. Had to use the lap top at the desk which I hate. Our room did not have a tub but I did not check if some rooms do have tubs. The bathroom was not clean. Do not book a room here if you are doing so for the Galeria mall since it is pretty average shopping. There are restaurants worth going to in walking distance which is nice since cabs are a problem in this area.

Reviews.Title: “Fine and professional”
Reviews.Author: mlasser
Reviews.Content: Nice location attached to an upscale mall. Grand Lux Cafe and Oceanaire are next door for dining options and the food court in the mall has a Five Guys Burgers, a Potbelly and other decent options. Hotel is clean. Good workout room and a nice pool for an inner city hotel. Didn't visit the executive lounge but Platinum guests do have access to it. Easy freeway access as well.

Reviews.Title: “Strong Recommend....could be top tier with a few minor tweaks”
Reviews.Author: mickshrimpton
Reviews.Content: We spent three nights at the Westin Galleria with our two young children and had a wonderful stay.
