Our room was standard with two double beds but was recently renovated and beautiful. The windows were spectacular and were nearly floor to ceiling. Our kids loved sitting, reading and drawing on the built in bench with cushions by the window. Nice LG Flat screen and typical lovely Westin beds/bedding. Our bathroom did not have one of the newly renovated full-size showers with frameless glass door, but rather a standard tub-shower combo. Because our kids take baths, this did not matter. Maid service, turn-down requests, bellman requests were all prompt. We had access to the spectacular concierge lounge on the 21st floor: great continental breakfast with smoked salmon and Starbucks and nice evening appetizer presentations (two hot foods such as eggrolls, chicken fingers, cheese selection and beer/wine). The women who worked in the 21st floor lounge were exceptionally helpful and gracious and especially kind to our children. Sometimes it's not worth upgrading to a club level but here it was definitely worth the price. The gym was exceptional with all top-of-the line Lifecycle Fitness equipment and machines. The connection to the Galleria mall was perfect for our kids and keeping them occupied with diversions to the ice rink, shopping, etc. The few issues we had were as follows: (1) the $10 charge for WIFI per day was absurd at a hotel of this caliber. Is Westin really making that much money on this charge to leave customers feeling nickel and dimed on what is an essential service to the modern traveler? Especially for SPG members or those paying extra for club level access, it's time to bag this silly incidental. (2) the pool area was lovely with great cabanas and nice fluffy towels. However, as echoed by previous comments, the water was unheated and nearly unswimmable. A little heating would go a long way. One other minor point: I had a great meal at the Second Floor restaurant but the service during the day was mediocre: it took almost an hour to get a sandwich and a bowl of soup. All told, these are minor issues (other than WIFI) compared to the positive aspects of this hotel. A strong recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice but pricey”
Reviews.Author: 1mayday1
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this property for a week in late August, 2010 while visiting a client in the Addison area. Overall I was very pleased with the hotel and its service. As one would expect it is stylish and clean. The service was very good. The room, bed, and amenities were high quality. The location is convenient to Addison and attached to a great mall - as the name implies. Only one word of warning, services at this hotel are pricey. Valet is $24 / night. My room service for an evening surpassed $100. This is not surprising given the high end nature of the hotel, but something to keep in mind.

Reviews.Title: “Exceeded expectations at every turn”
Reviews.Author: loveSPG
Reviews.Content: As a loyal SPG member, I was pleased this business conference was scheduled at a Westin! The hotel has been recently remodeled and there are pleasing touches at every turn. The executive lounge was superb, as were the staff there. Very pleasing and nice selections for evening appetizers and continental breakfast. I was delighted with the window seat and comfy decorative pillow...what a nice way to sit back and review notes or prepare for sessions! The room was huge and the bathroom generous. I loved the walk in shower; my colleagues room had a tub. The furniture was new (or appeared that way). Two great chairs of modern design and comfortable! The desk was long and adapter outlets easy to access and visualize. The dresser was built in the wall by the window...very tidy. The bathroom door was sliding glass. Very modern and posh, but anyone in the room can hear anything in the bathroom...so if sharing or have guests...that could be a bit dodgy! All the staff were professional and courteous and attentive. I was able to excercise my gold status with late check out, which was a great help to our group for luggage and one was ill, so she had a place to lay down on the last day. I was so pleased with everything. Thank you for a great stay.

Reviews.Title: “If that was a Heavenly Bed, I'm not sure I would want one”
Reviews.Author: molarmanmolarman
Reviews.Content: We have been married for 20 years and have frequently visited Dallas Tx. We had always wanted to stay at the Westin Galleria, but always stayed at less expensive hotels. We were celebrating a birthday and decided to stay at the Westin for the convenience of the location and proximity of the Galleria. We are in the market for a new mattress at home, and wanted to try out the Westin Heavenly Bed, as it is now sold to individuals for their homes. Upon arrival, we were greeted by no self-parking available in the surface lot and were offered $24 nightly valet parking or directed to a parking garage of the shopping center. When we found a parking place, we came up out of ground quite a distance from the hotel entrance. As we chose to self park, we accepted this inconvenience as our choice. When we opened the door to our room, we were met by a less than impressive appearance to our hotel room. The property had recently undergone a renovation, so we expected a warm, welcome environment. Instead, we were met with a bleak, half-empty, gray, dark hotel room. The carpeting and seating reminded us of the seating area at the airport gate. The back half of the room, approx 14x10 feet was completely empty, no furniture, just two very small chairs and a lamp. What happened to the furniture? The desk, nightstands, and headboard were contemporary formica laminated furniture. There were a couple of small pictures in the room, and it seems they were black and white too. Well, we didn't plan to spend much time in our rooms, so esthetics weren't as important. It did remind us of our single days staying in Motel 6 and it's lack of esthetics. Contemporary design can be relaxing, as is the Grand Hyatt at DFW. We love staying there before an early flight, but the Westin can learn a lot about decor from the Grand Hyatt. No comparison, Hyatt wins hands down. We looked forward to a good nights' sleep, away from the stress of home and the kids. We both slept very little and woke up with back aches. The bed was far from heavenly. Our "old" bed at home was much more comfortable. We will definitely not be purchasing a Heavenly Bed. Also, the bathroom was only supplied with 2 bath towels. My wife uses 2 towels herself, but we got by with the 2 supplied, didn't bother calling for more. We had already requested a mini-fridge to store some medication (the in-room fridge is electronically wired to your account---you can't touch or remove anything without being charged). We had planned to stay two nights, but phoned the front desk with our complaints of the bed. We weren't offered a different room, but were told we would not be charge an early departure fee. We checked out and went to Embassy Suites at Frisco. Had an excellent night's sleep there. I normally don't write reviews, but felt our less than pleasant stay should be reflected. We will give Westin another chance someday, just not at this location. Sorry, Westin, but you didn't live up to your 4-star rating.

Reviews.Title: “Happy 22nd Anniversary - Thank you Westin Galleria!”
Reviews.Author: BarryBrown
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here two years ago to celebrate our 20th Anniversary, and we enjoyed the service and ammenities so much that we decided to come back again this year on our anniversary. We are SPG Gold members so I called a couple days ahead of our arrival and asked for specific room preferences with a city view and I was told that would be no problem and was also told that they would put a "Do Not Move" on our reservation. Awesome! Or so I thought.... We arrived Friday for check in and to my surprise, we had been moved from the 18th floor city view room that I had arranged...flowers had already be delivered to the room. YIKES! While discussing this with the front desk person with my wife standing there, he discreetly told me that he would find me another room and asked us to wait over in the sitting area and he would bring us the key. As we were turning to go wait, I heard him tell a bell-hop to go to the room and get the flowers and move them to the new room. Shortly after that, he brought us the key to room 1907 on the Executive Club level. And he gave us access to the Executive Club for breakfast on the 21st floor! Wow! When we arrived to the room, it was far away from the elevator, it was quiet, it had a great city view and it had a built-in window seat that I had asked for. AND the huge flower bouquet had been re-delivered to our new room from the previous room that we were supposed to be in! Clearly, the Westin Galleria staff knows what customer service is really about...it's about ME the customer. The check-in process went very smoothly. The valet parking, albeit a bit pricey, went smoothly. The Continental Breakfast was typical, but satisfying. The only complaint I have was that they recently put new TV's in all the rooms and since then the A/V inputs have been disabled so watching anniversary movies were scratched from our plans. :( We had a nice relaxing stay at the Westin Galleria and would recommend this location to any that are staying in the Dallas area. Much nicer than the W in downtown Dallas. Thanks Westin Galleria for helping make our Anniversary Weekend Getaway very nice and relaxing.

Reviews.Title: “Valet Wrecked our car!”
Reviews.Author: rclewis1953
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Westin Hotel Galleria June 26th. It is pretty much mandatory you use valet on the weekend at this hotel. We bought a new car on Thursday and on Saturday we stayed at this hotel.We didn't realize how important it is to inspect your car every time valet brings it to you. Needless to say the car was perfect before it was parked by hotel employees. We checked out on the 27th and drove to a store across town. It was at this time we noticed a bad scratch on the back bumper where it had been apparently backed into a cement pillar. We drove back to the hotel and brought it to the valet supervisor's attention. He did an accident report but because we could not prove Westin Hotel valet caused the damage. Their claims company turned us down on liability. We had a pleasant stay until this unfortunante mishap. Whoever parked our car caused over 500.00 in damage. It will cost the hotel a lot more than that. How about a little customer service? Westin apparently hires a company out of Maryland to deflect complants. Most people probably just let it go after they turn down their claim. Not this time! R. Lewis

Reviews.Title: “Hotel is great, Conference services not up to par”
Reviews.Author: Aquaria
Reviews.Content: My co-workers and I attend a conference here most years, so we have seen it before and during renovations. It appeared to be all finished, and the decor is lovely. The beds were very comfortable. Our rooms were clean, spacious, and well-appointed. They have a flat-screen Hi-def TV, but I don't think the signal is all HD, so some channels are not good at all. You will have to pay $10-13 for high speed internet, and for a business hotel, this is really irritating. The location can't be beat - it is attached to the Galleria Mall, so you have access to shops, food court, ice-skating rink, etc. It's right off the freeway and not hard to get to. Save the money on valet and just park in the garage underneath. It's free, and we always got close to the hotel entrance. (Side note-if it rains, however, you will get wet - there is no way from the hotel to the garage that is covered, or so we were told.) Room service was excellent and right on time. Our conference services were really lacking this year compared to prior years. It is entirely possible this is the fault of the conference sponsors, I'm not sure. Both mornings, the continental breakfast ran out of food. Water and other drinks were not replenished until after lunch - so between morning sessions it was coffee or nothing. We had a banquet lunch both days, and it was the same chicken both days just dressed a little differently. And they pack WAY too many people in the area for a full-service lunch - about 12 to a table. With bread plates, 2 glasses each, utensils, dessert/bread/salad on the table...you couldn't move or reach anything without bumping something or someone. The afternoon snacks were inedible. I am hoping this was a one time glitch with the services, so I will try it again next year.

Reviews.Title: “great location and recently remodeled”
Reviews.Author: nuggetshow
Reviews.Content: Recently renovated the hotel is a great choice for north dallas/addison business. I have stayed here twice in the last few months and both times upgraded based on being SPG platinum. The club lounge staff is attentive and the food and beverage offering is excellent in the lounge area. The new rooms are very nice with HD programming on flat screen tv's, great bathrooms with deep tubs and seperate showers in the rooms i have stayed in. The westin workout facility is world class and on par with many resort properties i have stayed out ( TV's built in equipment with i-pod adapters). From business or a weekend shopping trip this is a terrific option!!

Reviews.Title: “Made our Mommy/daughter getaway very special!”
Reviews.Author: TXfamilyof5
Reviews.Content: American Girl Place at the Galleria was having a mom/daughter event, so my girls, ages 7 and 9, and I stayed at Westin after reserving the American Girl Package. The girls were ecstatic when we walked in the room and there were two mini beds for their American Girl dolls (that they got to take home), two trays of mini-cupcakes,two glasses of milk chilling in an ice bucket, and personalized cards waiting on the table! They were in Heaven! We had a wonderful room on the 4th floor overlooking the Galleria and the pool. The beds were comfy, decor was nice and modern, and our room was very clean. I don't know what they pump into this hotel, but it smells amazing! Everyone was very friendly, and check-in was easy and fast. I'll admit that I hate driving in Dallas, but this location was perfect. Great food and shopping is right there, so we never had to leave! All we had to do was go to the first floor and we were able to walk right into the Galleria Mall to shop and dine (the Grand Luxe was very good). My mom is coming to TX from Indiana, and I am picking her up in Dallas. We will definitely be staying at the Westin Galleria...can't wait to go back!

Reviews.Title: “Room nice enough but not 4 star service”
Reviews.Author: TTraveller50
Reviews.Content: Pro's: The room and lobby are nice. Comfy bed, updated furnishings. Purchased on discount site for reasonable rate so I was fine with the stay. The concierge was very good for the short time she was available. Will provide a mini fridge at no cost if you ask. Parking was available right in front of the hotel most of the time saving the $24 valet parking cost. The Valets were very accomidating with directions & other help. We had no issue with highway or other room noice - our room faced the mall. Con: If you are expecting 4 star service, you will be disappointed. Perhaps we were "edited" because we used the discount site? Or was it because it was the weekend? Details follow - you can skip, just know not to expect much. Made 2 extra calls to confirm that I had the 2 beds I reserved. Then I told there were only kings when I arrived. Was given a handicaped 2 bed room. That was fine but the conversation should never have taken place. Asked for a fridge (mini bar cannot have anything placed in it) that we needed when I called to confirm the reservation. Asked again when we checked in. Called housekeeping an hour later and it was promply brought up. I don't care about housekeeping every day (certainly don't need to change the sheets everyday) but I also didn't care about the $5 coupon. So, I agreed to their "no housekeeping program" . I realized after the fact that they would not even be bringing us coffee for the pot in the morning. I talked to the front desk, turned in the $5 voucher and asked if we could have coffee for the next morning. Yes, I will send it right up. By midafternoon, still no coffee so I stopped the housekeeper in the hall if I could have some coffee and she gave it to me. No other coffee ever arrived. Asked the morning after we arrived if there wasn't a book that explained pool hours, hotel amenties, room service ect? I was told it should be in the room. Assured them it was not in the room. Yes, I will send it right up. Asked again the next day. Finally someone brought just a room service menu up the afternoon before we were leaving. so, everytime I asked the front desk for something, nothing happened. If you just want a comfortable bed in a clean and room it is perfectly nice. Be aware that on Sundays, all the mall resturants close at 6:00pm. (there are still a few more formal rest open)

Reviews.Title: “What a wonderful hotel!”
Reviews.Author: DETBoulder
Reviews.Content: After spending week after week staying at Marriott Courtyards at various places around the country, this was like being on vacation. They definitely lived up to their "Heavenly" marketing campaign. The hotel smelled so wonderful, and the room was clean and modern, with very nice decoration. They even had an HD flat screen TV complete with Tivo/DVR functionality so I could re-wind and even recor part of the Olympics while I was at dinner. The location was fantastic, because it was attached to the Galleria, so you could do a little shopping if you wanted to. Just outside the second floor was the Corner Bakery, where I got a fantastic breakfast every morning for under $8. The Oceanaire restaurant is located just off their lobby, and I had some of the best fish I have ever eaten. What a fabulous experience. I recommend this hotel to anyone looking to relax and unwind while on business or pleasure.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful property, convenient to mall, but walls a little thin”
Reviews.Author: pbark
Reviews.Content: This was an excellent property for a girls weekend. Being connected to the mall makes it convenient for shopping and great restuarant selection. The room was spacious and nicely upgraded. The only negative is that the walls are a little thin. The occupant of the next room may have had their TV a little loud, but I could hear it through the wall around 12:00 am. I was on the 7th floor and I could also hear music from a reception or party on the 2nd or 3rd floor late one night. There is a $10-$12 charge for internet usage if you need it. Valet parking is available for a fee, but there is free parking right in front of the hotel. There was no problem finding a parking space on a Thursday night, but it got a little crowded over the weekend because mall patrons also use this space. Overall, pretty good stay. I would probably try another property if I stay in the area again just because of the noise issue, but you may get lucky and have a vacant room next door.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location!”
Reviews.Author: wc4bes
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this location over the New Year's weekend. Great Hotel, Great Location! Be sure to check out the on-site gym. One of the best I have ever seen at a hotel. Also the dining here is fab! Can't go wrong with a stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Beautifully refreshed classic Westin - great location.”
Reviews.Author: S4Snowflake
Reviews.Content: Recently renovated Westin is a great homebase for Dallas shopping and sightseeing. Galleria mall is upscale and has a cool ice skating rink in the middle. Very nice restaurants throughout the area. 20 minutes from downtown Dallas. Easy free parking or pay for the valet.

Reviews.Title: “Worst Valet Parking Anywhere”
Reviews.Author: DA10706
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the Westin Galleria and received a free Valet Parking voucher from a Westin employee. When I tried to get my car, the attendant refused the voucher and said it is $15. He then decided it was $12. After explaining the voucher and getting no where, I went inside and spoke to the front desk. They then had to spend 15 minutes on the phone with their manager to ultimately decide I still had to pay. Finally, I had to find the employee who gave me the voucher to explain my parking was free. I was shocked and dismayed that a hotel of Westin caliber would not accept their own inhouse vouchers and even argued the issue with me for 30 minutes. Also, the speed of the valet was VERY slow. I realize this hotel is at the galleria, however, when we arrived, we sat in one of two pull up lanes for 20 minutes before the attendant came to us. Also, the one restaurant we ate at there was horrible. My wife had pork chops that were extremely dry and tasteless and I had a halibut fillet that was dry and overcooked.

Reviews.Title: “Deal on Priceline, quick stay”
Reviews.Author: azwifey
Reviews.Content: I was going to be in town for only one night so I tried Priceline on a whim and with a bid of only $52 I got a room here. The hotel was easy to get to and the location was great! I didn't need to shop but if I did the galleria was accessible right off the lobby. The Grand Luxe right next door would be a great choice for lunch or dinner although I made plans with local friends so it wasn't needed. I was worried that such a cheap rate would give me subpar treatment but the staff treated me like any other guest and everyone was very friendly and professional. The room was very spacious and the bathroom was HUGE! I enjoyed it very much. The only thing I would have liked that it didn't have was a bathtub. I didn't need one but I was surprised to only see the shower - beautifully designed though. It was clean and great! If I ever find myself in Dallas again I would definitely book with them (or maybe hope for another $52 rate off priceline, ha!).

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel”
Reviews.Author: eastcoaster0
Reviews.Content: Don't let the bad reviews scare you, this is a fantastic hotel. Anyone who doesn't like this hotel must be used to staying at the Ritz or maybe can afford a $1,000 a night hotel. The rooms were clean, beautifully furnished, and very comfortable. It is a little pricey, but you get what you pay for. I stayed here while my husband attended meetings in the area, so I spent my days bumming around the hotel and attached mall. I could have spent the whole day in the comfy bed, and hours in the fantastic shower!

Reviews.Title: “Great Experience”
Reviews.Author: Louielori
Reviews.Content: You will feel high class staying here! The #1 benefit I had staying here was the unimaginably comfortable beds here. By far the best night sleep and makes u wake up with a smile!

Reviews.Title: “Bad experience”
Reviews.Author: goodfeetforwalk
Reviews.Content: very bad experience, Stay away if possible. The staff was not responsable and careless.

Reviews.Title: “We loved the Westin Galleria”
Reviews.Author: tonysoprano1000
Reviews.Content: I stayed 4 nights in the Westin Galleria. All was perfect, the service, food, location....all. Very safe hotel in the best area for someone who wants to shop like me. Gus in the front desk was very professional and friendly.....The girl of the valet was very cute all that days......The guy of the UPS store the same.........All.... Congrats for all the staff! Thanks a lot friends of Westin Galleria for our wonderful stay!

Reviews.Title: “Easy location and with the heat you can walk around the attatched mall”
Reviews.Author: markbusinesstraveler
Reviews.Content: The hotel is newly renovated with a dual head shower. The rooms are large with a great TV. It is attached to a mall so in the summer 100+ degree weather you can go for a walk and find plenty of restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “Would Definitely Stay Again”
Reviews.Author: ExploringDallas
Reviews.Content: I read several reviews, some good, some not so good, and was a bit skeptical, but decided to stay here anyway since I had a good experience recently at the Westin in Ft Lauderdale and the price ($95) was decent. My wife and were pleasantly surprised to find our 18th floor King sized room to be nicely decorated and very clean. Upon first entering the room the scent of aroma therapy was evident, which catered warmly to the senses. It has somewhat of a contemporary, European flair, but we like that kind of stuff. It should be noted that floors 15 thru 18 are for Starwood preferred guests, of which I am not, however, we were provided this room anyway...maybe because it was the weekend. (not sure if the non-Starwood preferred rooms are comparably equipped). The all white bed linens are of high quality and very comfortable and appeared almost brand new. There was a 32 inch lcd TV and a nice sized desk and high tech mesh chair for laptop work, if necessary. Two additional contemporary chairs offer the ability to read or just relax. The only "downside", and I don't really want to use that word, was that we were facing East, which gave us a "view" of the roof of the Galleria Mall. You only saw it though, if you were standing directly in front of the window and looked down. Otherwise from the bed or chair, we had clear view of eastern horizon. One review was correct in that the fridge was not meant to store your own goods, but rather there in the event you need a quick fix. Along the same wall is a nice built-in cabinet with plenty of drawers for clothes as well as a safe. The bathroom does not have a tub, however, the walk-in shower is very nicely decorated with subway type tiles and the bathroom counter is granite or limestone, I believe. Both were very clean I must say. If a tub is a necessity, then this will not work, but I'm of the opinion that showers are a bit more sanitary, for what it's worth. I read reviews that complained about the parking and the non-free internet access. I don't like being "forced" into valet parking and was able to avoid it by finding parking directly in front of the hotel. Being that we returned to the hotel after 11pm each night, we didn't seem to have a problem finding a spot. In fact, there were several each night. I guess if it were earlier in the evening, the Galleria Mall parking lot would have been an alternative, albeit a little less convenient. Personally, I'll walk the extra few feet to save $24! In regards to internet access, another "trick" I discovered, was to simply go into the mall and use the free wi-fi at either the 'Corner Bakery' or at 'Starbucks'. They are both located literally as soon as you enter the mall from the 2nd floor hotel lobby. Instead of paying the $11.95 Westin access fee, you can sit and have breakfast and watch the kids ice skating in the Galleria skating rink. The wi-fi reception was excellent. I think the Westin should take a tip from the 'Bakery' and 'Starbucks' and just offer the service for free!! Overall we had a very enjoyable experience at the Westin and would gladly stay there again. We thought about the Hotel Zaza and the Crown Plaza, but at $300+ each, respectively, we saved enough money to go and have dinner there instead. Unless there is a need to stay in very close proximity to downtown Dallas, I have no problem recommending a stay at the Westin Galleria.

Reviews.Title: “Too many errors”
Reviews.Author: mille125
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for one night with my family. I am a frequent traveller and usually stay in Four Seasons, St Regis, Ritz-Carlton, etc. I know that there is quite a difference between these hotels and the Westin. I am not trying to hold the Westin to the same standard as these brands. However, too many errors occurred on this stay for me to recommend this hotel. The Good: 1) We asked for a connecting room since I was travelling with three children under the age of five. I felt that they did go out of their way to insure that this happened. 2) Location is very good in the galleria. The Bad 1) As another guest commented, the room keys continually malfunctioned. 2) My wife and I ordered room service and asked for our burgers to be cooked "medium well". Both came to the room cooked no better the rare (almost raw). It was quite disgusting. 3) All of our kids were sleeping in our connecting room. The hotel room service decided to call into this room at 11 PM even though the front desk had instructions to not ring the phone in this room. It woke everyone up which as you can imagine did not win me over. The Ugly: 1) There was the biggest cockroach that I have ever seen in the bathroom. I am tempted to put a picture of it on this site. I showed the picture to the front desk and he promptly removed valet charges from our bill (inadequate compensation in my opinion). I just cannot recommend this hotel and will not likely stay here again....

Reviews.Title: “Could not have been nicer !!!”
Reviews.Author: nurseparker
Reviews.Content: We had the best experience at the Westin ! Have shopped in Dallas a lot and have always stayed at hotels away from the Galleria area - but chose to stay where we start our shopping this time .... GREAT plan... it was wonderful. The room was great ... all what you expect from the Westin ! The beds and amenities are great - but what wins all awards with this property is the location !! Nothing is better than being able to walk right out into the Galleria - morning or night ! I love it and plan to utilize this location on future trips ! All of the hotel employees were very nice ! Would highly recommend this hotel for anyone that enjoys Dallas and the Galleria !

Reviews.Title: “One step up from a Holiday Inn”
Reviews.Author: Lulu1235
Reviews.Content: I was not impressed during my recent stay at the Westin Galleria. Here's why: I paid extra for access to the Club level and my key card didn't work. Same thing happened the morning of my check-out...I went to grab some coffee and when I returned to my room I was locked out. This happened even before check-out time. The beds were comfortable as was the shower, but I wasn't a fan of the pocket doors in the bathroom. I actually jammed my hand while trying to close the door. The hotel is not insulated very well for outdoor sound as I was woken up around 2 am by bikers even though I was on a high floor (20th). No outlets near the bed for a laptop or cell phone. No amenities such as sewing kit, shower cap, etc. I don't use them, but I thought it was strange that they were missing. I forgot to mention that the gym has the worst odor. Don't even bother. The restaurant was just ok and the service was slow. The front desk staff were very nice, but it really was not what I expected. Next time I visit Dallas, I'll stay elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Great one night stay”
Reviews.Author: jenluvscreed
Reviews.Content: We got so lucky and found a great price for this hotel on expedia.com. We were looking for a good hotel for only one night and really lucked out. Check in was super smooth and the room was fabulous. The downside is that with it being right there at the Galleria we did pay to valet (24 bucks for the night). But was worth not having to go and find a spot at this busy mall on a friday night. PLus we had a lot of luggage (traveling with a 3 year old) and I sure didn't want to carry it all up. They had a cupcake bar at check in but since we hadn't eaten dinner yet we ahd to pass. But thought that was really cool and really trying to cater to travlers with kids. We ran over to the mall (nevering leaving hotel or being out in the Texas heat) and did some quick shopping and then hit TheGrand Lux Cafe. Delicious food and worth the money. If you go, remeber that portions are huge and very easy to share. We really enojyed our one night and hope to go back in a couple of weeks before school starts and do some more shopping!

Reviews.Title: “The nicest hotel we've ever stayed at!”
Reviews.Author: happyfamilyTexas
Reviews.Content: We just returned home from the best hotel experience we've ever had. The hotel is very luxurious, very clean and comfortable. All of the staff was extremely professional and friendly. Upon arrival our children got to decorate cupcakes with the staff in the lobby. The pool area that's not pictured on their website is phenominal....a bit cold but nice. They have a lot of lounge chairs and 3 big cabanas a whole family and rest under. The workout area is big and very nice. The glass shower stalls are beautiful and roomy. It's connected to the Galleria mall that has anything you would want to do in it, ice skating included. We didn't eat at the hotel due to the $$$ but dined most every meal in a different place at the mall. Everything about this stay was completely satisfactory!!!! I'd recommend it to anyone. The rate we paid was unbelievable also for that quality of hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Exceeded ALL My Expectations”
Reviews.Author: Andrea in Texas
Reviews.Content: Let me preface this review by saying that while I do travel and stay in hotels for my job several times a year, I am typically booked into hotels of the Quality Inn, Clarion Hotel or Holiday Inn variety, so a Westin is above the caliber of my usual lodging. If my review seems a bit too flattering you can put it off to that, lol. We live about 11/2 hours north of Dallas and I would not consider myself to be knowledgeable about highways in the city, but the Westin was very easy to get to. It is just off the LBJ Freeway at the intersection of the Dallas North Tollway. I booked a two night stay at this hotel through Priceline asking for a 4* in the Galleria area for my soon to be 8 year old daughterâ€™s birthday. We wanted a hotel close to this particular mall, the Galleria, because of its proximity to the Holy Land of 8 year old girls dreams, The American Girl doll store. The Westin is not close to the mall, it is ATTACHED to the mall and about 50 yards from the American Girl store. My daughter was in Nirvana as we drove up and she realized this. The hotel offers valet parking ($18 + tax), but there is no dedicated parking solely for hotel guests so I opted for the free self-parking in the area next to the hotel as there were several open spaces. (Saturday when we came back from the Science Place, there were no longer any spaces there, but there is plenty of free parking in the underground garages. Park in the purple one as close as you can to the yellow tunnel and you will walk up the steps and come out right next to the hotel). Walking in to the lobby you hit a wall of a/c that is very welcome in Texas in the summer, but the front desk is set off to the left side and if you continue walking you are in the mall. A bit strange to me as I expect 4* hotels to have grand lobbies. Check-in was fast (on our drive down we called and asked if early check-in was available and they accommodated us at 11 am!) efficient and friendly. The front desk clerk, I wish I had gotten his name, was super friendly and he gave my daughter a bag with Westin Kids Club stuff. I did not know anything about this and would not have expected it having booked on Priceline, so we felt very important and welcomed as though we were high level members of the hotel reward club. We were booked into room 1301, yes they have a 13th floor, and so off we went to see our room. The room is spacious with a window seat that is 8 feet in length and padded overlooking the pool and Dallas skyline with a retractable mesh window shade for filtering outside light and privacy curtains to block all light. The bed is king sized with a lovely teak looking headboard with attached nightstands. The mattress is supremely comfortable and the bed is triple sheeted with linens that are on par with the 600 tc sheets at my own home. There are 4 pillows on the bed and an extra in the closet and our request for two more, and two terry cloth bathrobes, was met promptly. There is a built in armoire that contains drawers for clothing, the coffee maker-with Starbucks!, a safe and the mini-bar (no liquor-but water is $6). The desk area is built into the wall and has a modular rolling chair. A 35â€� flat panel TV is on top of it directly across from the bed. There are two more chairs and one leather ottoman. The closet is large with plenty of hangers and contains an iron and ironing board. A full length mirror is next to it. The room has a distinct â€œAsianâ€� feel to it. Very streamlined and modern and the cleanliness level is immaculate. The bathroom is somewhat small considering how large the room is, but is quite nice. Granite vanity, HUGE glass enclosed shower with two shower heads (no bathtub) and nice sized White Tea scented shampoo, conditioner, etcâ€¦The bathroom door is a sliding door of frosted glass that I found to be odd but my daughter loved. The towels are fluffy and plentiful. Now, onto the features outside of the room. The pool area, on the 4th floor, is lovely. There are many comfortable lounge chairs, sofas, and tables, but what we really loved are the â€œbedsâ€� at the pool with the table in the middle. There was only one other family when we first went swimming on Friday night and even Saturday afternoon and Sunday morning the pool was NEVER crowded. I was surprised at the coolness of the water temperature considering it was July in Texas, but it was better than the water being too hot. The workout gym, also on the 4th floor, is huge. They provide cold filtered water, towels and personal headphones. The equipment looked to be all new. There is a small gift shop on the same floor, but it is overpriced as all hotel gift shops are. I did not use them, but there is also a Fed Ex business center and a car rental office on the same floor. One other nice thing about the hotel is that they have the Dallas Morning News or the NY Times available at the front desk on the weekends for free. I appreciated having the paper to read over breakfast. BTW, the La Madeleine in the Galleria, it is on the bottom level next to the ice skating rink, has wonderful food. We ate breakfast there both days and bought several bags of their cookies to take with us for snacks. I can also recommend The Corner Bakery CafÃ© for lunch. Soups, salads and sandwiches on freshly baked bread. Inexpensive and tasty. We did not utilize the hotelâ€™s restaurants, they did not look particularly appealing places to take a child, but are probably great for adults. All of the staff at this hotel were all extremely pleasant and helpful to my 7 year old daughter and myself. I would stay here again in a heartbeat and will recommend the hotel to anyone that would like a clean, beautiful hotel connected to the Galleria Mall.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Stay, We'll be back!”
Reviews.Author: straightandnarrow
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel inside the Galleria mall. Nice location, great rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic!”
Reviews.Author: collierje
Reviews.Content: It would be hard to ask for more than this hotel offers! I love the updated look and amenities. The staff is absolutely top notch, and the location is very nice!

Reviews.Title: “It was nice, but I expected more.”
Reviews.Author: abankard
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very beautiful both inside and out. I liked the layout of the room. It was peaceful, the bed was comfortable, and the lighting was just right to relax. I loved being connected to the Galleria; a big plus in my opinion. Also, the pool area was nice and the gym had everything you need to work out on a trip. However, the air condition never cooled the room. The outside temperature was about 90, and I sweated the whole time in the room with the air as cold as I could get it. To me, this was a major letdown. But besides the air condition, I would recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “excellent business location hotel, more upscale than many in area...”
Reviews.Author: chicagojoe_9
Reviews.Content: despite other reviews, I liked the room decor. it was very functional for a business trip. no fussy nonsense to deal with. everything streamlined and clean. typical immaculate westin linens. lights with dimmers. windows coverings very clean and streamlined (mesh window shade for dimming outside light and privacy curtains to block all light). nice touch - warmed segment of bathroom mirror to prevent fogging, best thing when you are shaving. Pool closed for work while I was there, but otherwise everything was fine. fitness center was good, not the best but better than a teeny basement room.

Reviews.Title: “We Stopped Here On Our Wedding Night and........”
Reviews.Author: RavishingRobRude
Reviews.Content: Very nice, great rooms, friendly staff and one of the nicest showers I've ever seen. The breakfast was very expensive we ordered 2 breakfast to the room that cost us $61.. Great Location and very close to Addison and backs onto the Galleria Shopping so your sorted..We will be coming back but not ordering breakfast..

Reviews.Title: “My husband now loves Westin”
Reviews.Author: cyntul2no
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a medical conference. My husband had lectures and I shopped. He had good compliments about the amenities for the conference and the things provided for breakfast and the breaks. We both felt the room was huge, nicely decorated, comfortable and clean. the only drawback was the frosted glass door to the bathroom- while it was cool looking, it was a problem in the morning when I wanted to continue to sleep and he had to get ready for his meetings as the light came through. We had good service from the front desk and the valets. It is close to several good restaurants and convienent for getting on the freeway to see other parts of Dallas. Dallas itself doesn't seem to have much to do, but the hotel was great.

Reviews.Title: “Very disappointing almost ruined Anniversary”
Reviews.Author: KWPlano
Reviews.Content: We were very disappointed and concerned. When we came back to our room to relax and go to sleep, the room air conditioner would not cool the room, so we had engineering come up and fix it. That was fine until the next morning, when the room was too cool and the system would not heat. We had to again call and have it fixed. I had to go down to the front desk and talk to the Manager on Duty at the time and change rooms. Not sure if it was ever fixed, and did not want to have another disturbed night. Now to something that disturbed us more. After the air â€œwas fixedâ€� the first night, I turned down the bed and found what looked like Blood spots on the sheets. (see attached photo) After just spending a half an hour with an engineer we had to call the operator and spend another 45 minutes with a maid and her sorting through 3 other sheets some that she brought and some she had to go get as extras to find and replace ours with clean sheets. Several were spotted or dirty also. The maid said it was rust from the driers????? Was told later it was from bad irons. These incidents and the time and frustration almost ruined our anniversary. Westin gave us upgraded room and provided us with free breakdfast. I had "steak and eggs" Would not reccommend was a Bowl?? with potatos and beef and eggs. Was not appitizing at all. Hated to complain again. Just not a very good customer service in my opinion. Even wrote Westin and they felt I was compensated enough for them almost ruining our anniversary.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel. Modern but uninspired.”
Reviews.Author: gnolect
Reviews.Content: I expect Westin to be a cut above and this hotel meets the criteria. Room was oversized. Plenty of space. Large windows. Updated Bathroom. Clean. Comfortable. Modern. But boring. It builds off the idea that less is more. Room has very modern sparse decor. Overall I have no complaints, but it's not where I would want to spend a vacation. Location is convenient off the tollway. And there is a wold class mall connected to the hotel. But the view is dead boring, flat and ugly. It overlooks the highway. The whole area outside the mall parking lot has nothing of interest. Our convention room rate was more reasonable that the $299 internet price. I would not stay here for $300 of my own money per night! And everything else about the hotel was way overpriced. $24/night for valet parking. $13/day for internet access. $4 for a minibar soft drink. $8 for a beer in the lounge. The good news is that it is convenient to the highway and its easy enough to drive to better restaurants, less expensive bars and much more interesting places. So my recommendation is sleep here if you can get a good price because it's clean, comfortable and convenient. But leave as much as possible to find things less expensive and more interesting.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel. Good location”
Reviews.Author: raskinco
Reviews.Content: The Westin is not the nicest Westin I stayed at, but overall the were no major issues. The location is very good. There were lots of restaurants close by to say nothing of it being attached to a 3 story mall with ice rink. The only complaints were minor. The hallway on our floor smelled a little funky. Could not quite put my finger on it, but it did not penetrate into the room. The rooms were nice and and I think recently remodeled. They were good size and of course the Westin beds were comfortable. We stayed using Starwood points so we certainly had no complaints about the price. There is free parking in the Galleria parking garage. I would say it was 150 to 200 dollar a night hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Average”
Reviews.Author: TravelForWork2007
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Westin the night of 3/26. This was a last minute trip, so I was not able to book weeks in advance. All of the online rates started at $199/night. I booked the room online via hotwire.com on 3/24. I selected a 4 star hotel in the Galleria area and this was the one that I ended up purchasing. Of course, I did not know the name of the hotel until I made the non-refundable purchase, but I was okay with any 4 star hotel in the Galleria area for one night. The rate that I paid was $69.00 plus Hotwire.com's fee of approx. $16, brining my total to $85.00. At $85.00 this was a GREAT choice, but I would not pay more than $125 (at most) a night for this hotel. The hotel was definitely nice, but not sure if it is worth $199 a night. PRO: Comfy bed - Starwood properties tend to have SUPER EXTREME FIRM mattresses, but this one was ok PRO: Clean PRO: Great Location PRO: Valet and Self Parking available So-So: Noisy - I was on the 16th floor facing the North Dallas Tollway. I could hear lots of street noise. Not something that the hotel can control - so request an odd numbered room so that you will be on the other side. CON: Only shower stalls in the bathroom, no bath tubs CON: Did not like the â€œbareâ€� look to the room. Felt kind of cold and empty. CON: Fee for internet I did not make use of the pool (not sure if it is even open) or room service, so I can not comment on those services. I included a picture of the cabinets that contain a safe for your valuables, a stocked fridge ($$$), snacks ($$$), coffee maker, and dresser drawers. I would stay at this Westin again, but only if the rate were below $125 a night.

Reviews.Title: “Bad Service, Specifically Room Service”
Reviews.Author: Tila2000
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I booked a 1 night stay here on Valentines Day. We paid extra for the indulgence package which included champagne & strawberries, breakfast in-room or in restaurant and late check-out. Upon arrival I asked the front desk to send the champage/strawberries to our room in 30 minutes. 30 minutes later we had not received either so I called the front desk to check on the status of our request. The lady I spoke to said she would find out and call me back. She never called back but our order was delivered 15 minutes later (a bottle of champagne and only FOUR strawberries). We had just got there! They should have been on top of things. In the morning I ordered breakfast in the room at 9:30am. The lady who took my order said it would take an hour to recieve it. I was fine with that, but an hour later - no breakfast! I called the front desk again who then connected me with food services. Food services said it was on the way. 30 minutes later - still no breakfast. On the way, huh??? I called back, the lady who answered apologized but said it was going to be a little bit longer. So, I asked to speak with a manager. The manager told me that they were extremely busy and off schedule and that it would take another 30 minutes to get out breakfast or if we came doen to the restaurant we would be served right away. What is the point of IN-ROOM SERVICE then??? I told her that we wanted to eat in the room and that we would wait. She apologized. I asked her for a discount on the room (she didn't offer a discount) for all the frustration and inconveniences we had undergone. She gave us a credit, but we didn't get our breakfast until 2 HOURS LATER! Talk about horrible service! I will never go back there or recommend Westin Galleria.

Reviews.Title: “Stylish business hotel”
Reviews.Author: Randolph314
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Westin for about a week on business. I was very happy with the hotel. The rooms were comfortable, stylish, and spacious, the room service was good, and it had all the business amenities I needed. It was also convenient staying above a shopping mall. My only problem with the hotel was location - it's in the middle of nowhere.

Reviews.Title: “The Best!”
Reviews.Author: glatstein
Reviews.Content: My niece was married at the hotel and most of the out of town guests stayed at the Westin. From the late night welcome to weary travelers at the registration desk, to the bellhops, room service, hospitality room, etc. the experience was great. Rooms were huge, sunny, and beautifully furnished.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed With Westin's New Look”
Reviews.Author: Fifiann
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the recently revamped Westin Galleria on the 5th because the company Christmas party was being held near by. This was our penultimate stay in a Starwood property before achieving Platinum status so please bear in mind when reading this review that I am very familiar with Starwood, and Westin in particular. We checked into our Preferred floor room and, as usual, my first impulse was to inspect the bathroom. I was dismayed to find, that though there was a very nice walk in shower, there was no bath tub. As a woman, and particularly when going to a dressy event, I like to soak in the tub with a glass of wine before getting ready. We called and changed rooms (to one on a regular floor), but in the process found out that there are no King rooms with tubs and very few doubles with tubs. As the bellman explained, all the tubs had been removed as part of the renovation. It is quite clear to me that no woman was involved in the redesign of the hotel and that the guest that is being catered to is a lone business MAN. Now, he may be the main client of this hotel, but we saw plenty of couples and families during our stay. I have always appreciated the classic Westin look: pale cream walls, white linens, dark wood, delicately coloured pictures and a slightly Japanese feel. The furniture in this hotel looks like high end IKEA. Not that I mind the Scandanavian look, but this was too stark, sharp edged and minimalist. The carpet is charcoal coloured, the walls beige, the pictures black and white and the soft furnishings muted rust red and dark aqua. There is no colour accent (the most colourful thing in the room is the cheap TV remote control). The room is completely washed out sepia toned: tasteful, but extremely depressing and unwelcoming. The bathrooms are small. Given the size of the rooms, they had ample space to work with to extend the bathrooms and include a walk in shower AND a tub. That shower was also designed by a man - it has room for a bench but doesn't have one. When will men get it that women need something to put their leg up on to shave? Another clue that the room was designed with single occupancy in mind is the bathroom door. It is attractive to be sure. It is made from translucent glass. So, when you go to the bathroom in the middle of the night you flood the entire room with light and disturb your sleeping partner. Form over function. The corridors and elevators are similarly decorated in washed out sepia tones. It looks like a suite of upmarket corporate suites, not a hotel. I am worried that this is the direction that all Westins are moving in. A couple of weeks ago I stayed at the Westin Market Street in San Francisco which also had a dismal corporate look (although not quite as extreme as this). We paid a special introductory internet rate of $99 so I cannot complain too much. If I was paying the regular rate which is about double, I would have been disappointed. If my husband had been by himself as the lone business man, he would have been find with it - although he said that more than a couple of nights would have got to him too. I appreciate that this is mainly about aesthetics which is a very personal thing, and if the aesthetics of this hotel appeal to you (and lack of bath tub), then there are no problems.

Reviews.Title: “LOVE IT!”
Reviews.Author: avillebud
Reviews.Content: I stayed here over TX OU weekend 2008. The hotel is very nice. The rooms are clean and fresh. The staff was very friendly and had a "house divided" theme going for the TX OU weekend. The gym is very nice. It is an updated Westin Workout Gym. I was comfortable in the room. The AC worked... there were no problems at all. The hotel is located in the Galleria and that made it nice for quick trips for shopping and for breakfast. Its not easy to walk to other places around the area. But Dallas in general is not very pedestrian friendly.

Reviews.Title: “A better location than Downtown Dallas”
Reviews.Author: gliding_along
Reviews.Content: When we drove up my first reaction was: oh oh. We are not in the middle of town. Truth is, Downtown Dallas is * ahem * a tad gritty. The Westin Galleria is in a commercial, but upscale area. I felt 100% safe. Downtown has a criminal court, probation center and other cheery municipal buildings. The Galleria is about 15-20 minutes North. My only gripes with the room are that the Heavenly Bed is too . . . "poofy." Lots of sheets and pillows. The A/C was a little hard to regulate (Room 921) but not a too-doo. Free coffee in the lobby. Con: gone well before 7 a.m. Nice gym. Fast elevators. Desk service: eh, but not insulting or mean. Just a bit daffy.

Reviews.Title: “Sad decline of an old friend”
Reviews.Author: rzrback62
Reviews.Content: After a weekend trip to Dallas, and a stay at a downtown property, we ended up having to stay over an additional night and decided to head up to the Westin. We have stayed here dozens of times from the late 90's. Have not been here in a couple of years now(since their renovation in '07). In years past, the property was always clean, comfortable, and a reasonable value for its class. I now consider this hotel one of my least desirable choices if I were to need to stay in Dallas. Upon check-in, I casually mentioned about my spouse looking forward to a soak in the tub...the agent informed me that there are no longer bath tubs in ANY King bedded rooms in the Hotel...I am serious!!! We were on one of the frequent guest floors; the "new" carpet is in terrible shape; the "heavenly bed" sheets felt like sandpaper. I can't help but think Starwood has let this property go because of cost cutting measures. For $ 299 a night, I will have to take my business to a newer, comfortable property. Goodbye to an old friend with lots of good memories, but you will never see me again.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible experience here; avoid at all costs”
Reviews.Author: theboone
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at many Westin hotels and never had a problem before the Westin Dallas (Galleria). Westin claims there is a refrigerator in EVERY room. They are only half right. All conventional refrigerators were replaced with "REFRESHMENT VENDING REFRIGERATORS." These are like refrigerators, but if you even touch any item inside then you will be charged (since it calculates by weight and automatically bills the room). There is a sign that informs you of this and says conventional refrigerators are available by calling room service. I called room service only to find out they were all being used (I doubt they even have any). The "GUEST SERVICES" attendant said "you can just use the vending refrigerator in your room, but be sure to call the front desk each time you move something so you won't get billed for it, since it's done by weight. In short, THEY WANTED ME TO CALL THE FRONT DESK EACH TIME I TOOK A SIP OF MILK AND PUT IT BACK IN THE REFRIGERATOR. Also, they charge $10 per day for internet and it didn't work half the time. I spoke to the front desk lady who said, "here is the 800 number for tech support, you will need to call them to report it being down." APPARENTLY, IT WAS MY JOB TO BE THE IN-HOUSE TECH SUPPORT GUY. The hotel itself was under construction the whole time and had rude staff members. Summary: -RUDE STAFF -EXPECT YOU TO REPORT EACH "WEIGHT CHANGE" IN THE FRIDGE -CHARGE $10 PER DAY FOR INTERNET THAT DOESN'T WORK -EXPECT YOU TO HELP THEM FIX THE BROKEN INTERNET -OVERPRICED Do not stay at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Renovation!”
Reviews.Author: Bigmama2n1
Reviews.Content: We travel to the Dallas area frequently but had never stayed at this particular hotel mainly because it was listed so far down on the list of favorites on this site. I'm so glad we tried it. I arrived after a 300 mile drive a bit after noon and the valet told me he was sure I would be able to go ahead and check in, but when questioned he admitted to me I would probably receive a better room if I could wait till a bit later to check in. He then directed me to where I could park and my daughter and I followed his advice and left to explore the American Girl store and Bistro for a couple of hours. When we pulled back around to the valet the same extremely helpful employee greeted us and asked my daughter if she had enjoyed her experience at American Girl and cheerfully unloaded my car onto a bellman cart for me. We were able to check in quickly and were given a room on the 17th floor. We opened the door to a very spacious two queen bedded room. The room also included a very nice window seat with a view that looked over the busy traffic of the tollway below. The room was very clean and tastefully decorated in a modern decor with a plasma TV and ample electrical outlets for cellphone chargers etc. The Heavenly bed Westin offers was indeed heavenly as always. The bathroom had a very unique door as it was a large sliding frosted glass door with a green tint to it in keeping with the modern furnishings. We were "back to school shopping" and this hotel couldn't have been more perfect for our purpose since the Galleria Mall is literally a few steps from the elevator. We were able to make frequent trips back and forth to deposit heavy bags to our room with some stores even offering us assistance to deliver our bags to our room for us. Although I did notice there was still construction taking place when I was in front of the hotel, I was never bothered with any kind of noise. I did not explore the pool area as I had read on their website that it was still undergoing work. All of the staff at this hotel were all extremely pleasant and helpful to my 9 year old daughter and myself. We will more than likely reserve a room here next time we come to the city to shop.

Reviews.Title: “Caution-Under Construction”
Reviews.Author: JonasMiami
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for one night on business January 23rd. I had no idea (nor was informed) the hotel was under construction. After checking in around 10 PM, I sat down to rest in the 2nd floor lounge area. Shortly after sitting down, a crew of no less then 75 construction workers are filing up the escalator lugging all sorts of equipment and pieces of scaffolding which they proceed to set up in an area adjacent the second floor elevators. Are you kidding me? I am paying $269 for about 8 hours in my room, and I need to see this? The pool is apparently under renovation, as are many spots in the interior, as well the front entrance. This should have been disclosed. Needless to say, I was not happy. To top it all off, the next morning, well before 7AM, I was awoken to the extremely loud noise of power equipment and concrete saws from the lower floors. How is this possibly acceptable? Either you shut down the hotel until the repairs are completed, or you let the rooms go at $100 a night with the caveat that you will be on an active construction site. The rooms are beautiful, and this will have the potential to be a fine hotel. However, as a longtime Starwood member, I was not pleased with this stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great for Business”
Reviews.Author: jpbarkan
Reviews.Content: I always stay here for business and it is in a great location with great restaurants nearby. Connected to the hotel is a mall that has good places to have breakfast meetings and also for dinner and rinks. The hotel is going through some renovations which can give off a negative initial look but the rooms are very nice with a nice desk and flat panel TV. If going to Dallas and choosing between a Westin stay at this one rather then downtown.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service and wonderful stay!”
Reviews.Author: worldtraveler786
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the Westin Galleria Dallas three nights for a conference and had a wonderful, stress-free stay. The hotel has undergone a major renovation, though many of its common rooms are still in the process of being renovated. Overall, the look is sleek and modern, and the hotel seamlessly fits into its location as part of the Galleria. The front staff was excellent, and I had no problems checking in. In fact, after checking into my original room (10th floor), I requested the front desk to move me to a higher room (15th floor) facing away from the highway, and my needs were promptly met. The concierge was also fantastic and spent a lot of time helping me plan my free time away from the conference (Northpark Mall, Grapevine Mills, Dallas Arboretum, etc.) The room itself was nothing less than what I expected from a Westin hotel: spacious, immaculate and comfortable with a modern finish (flat-screen TV, mini bar and safe all included). The bed was very comfortable, and I loved the double headed shower in the bathroom. The room was quiet, and I did not have any noise problems during my stay. I also enjoyed the small touches throughout the hotel. On each floor by the elevator, a bowl of fresh fruit and copies of the daily newspaper are available to take. The Galleria mall is accessible from the 1st and 2nd floors of the hotel, and I loved the option of dropping my shopping bags off to my room when they got too heavy and then coming back down to continue shopping. While the Dallas Galleria is smaller than the one in Houston, it's still a nice place to go shopping and people watching, with a large ice rink in the center. For dining options, the Oceanaire seafood restaurant is located on the first floor of the hotel, whereas other options such as Grand Lux Cafe are located within the Galleria mall proper. The location of the hotel is also fairly central - it took me 15-20 minutes to drive downtown and the same amount of time to drive to the DFW airport. On the down side, the hotel charges a steep, daily fee for internet usage, and currently, there is no "hotel" restaurant where you can charge directly to your room. Overall, the Westin Galleria Dallas is a great business/conference hotel and a good bet for those visitors wanting to do some serious shopping.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place”
Reviews.Author: ILuv2Travel76
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Westin Galleria for two nights for a business trip. The room and bathroom were very spacious, light and airy and the bed was one of the most comfortable beds I've ever slept in at a hotel. I ordered room service one of the nights and although it was a bit pricey it was really good. The hotel is conveniently attached to the mall which is great if you are there to shop. The doormen and front desk staff were very nice and helpful. No problems getting taxis from the hotel. It does have an outdoor pool, but I didn't have time to use it. For being in a mall though I was surprised by the hotel's dinky gift shop...the only place to pick up a snack after the mall closes. Overall it was a nice place to stay and if I had more time in the area it would be a place to check out again.

Reviews.Title: “Not So Great”
Reviews.Author: troy902
Reviews.Content: Weekend stay in Dec after Christmas was not so great. At reservation time was guaranteed connecting rooms w/ 2 queen bds per room. At check-in was told those rooms did not exist connecting - which was a problem since we had teens in the next room. We ended up on roll away beds. Not comfortable at all. Desk clerk was no help and basically did not care at all. The renovations are a joke. The furniture looked like the kind you screw together - very cheap. The bathroom door is a frosted glass door that does not lock so when you go in and turn the light on, your shadow can be seen by anyone that walks by - very uncomfortable feeling for my wife and sister. Basically, they tried, but missed by a mile. Used to love to stay there, but won't in the future!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great location. Nice hotel.”
Reviews.Author: lucida509
Reviews.Content: We recently spent the weekend in Dallas and stayed at the Westin. The room was large and clean. The bed was very comfortable. We were in one of the rooms that had recently been renovated (11th floor) and it was very nice. While the room was clean, we did notice some dust on the end table and on the windowsill. The person who checked us in was very pleasant and helpful. The valet was nice and had our SUV available quickly each time we called. The location of the hotel is perfect. The galleria offers great shopping and there are some excellent restaurants nearby. We ate at Lawry's one night and it was about 5 minutes from the hotel. The second night we ate at Oceanaire which is located in the lobby of the hotel. The seafood was absolutely outstanding. The price of our room included breakfast so we ordered room service one morning and ate at the restaurant the second morning. The food is okay but a bit overpriced for what you get. I would suggest eating breakfast instead at La Madeleine which is located next to the ice rink in the galleria. It was virtually deserted at breakfast time and offers a good variety at great prices.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel but a little pricey”
Reviews.Author: kling
Reviews.Content: Went to Dallas for a Thanksgiving weekend shopping trip. The Hotel is in the middle of a major renovation. The room was great, very clean and spacious. The Bathroom was small but the new showers was great. The beds was fantastic. I loved the window seat allowing you to sit and look out at all the city lights. Cons.....The air in the room was not working very well. Set the thermostat to 65 and it was still very warm in the room. The restuarant was very over priced. $18 hamburgers etc. We ate at the oceanaire resturant and it was good food but be prepared to spend $150 + before the bar bill.
